Reviews.Title: “Charged for four people when we only had two guests!”
Reviews.Author: bren b
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February and booked through booking.com Our booking confirmation came through and clearly said our booking was for $392 plus taxes. The total should have come to about $450 but when I checked my bank statement I saw that i had been charged almost $100 more. I wrote to the hotel and after quite a few days eventually received a reply. it then took numerous emails for them to finally admit that they had charged us extra because they thought we had 4 people in the room. we did not book for four people, at no point did any extra people visit the room and we certainly never authorised them to charge the extra money to my account. they still have not apologised and said that they would pay back my money "as a measure of good faith" as if they were not obliged to pay back my own money which they had taken without authorisation. check your bank balance if you're staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time NYC Experience”
Reviews.Author: 1catsmeow
Reviews.Content: I had no idea where to stay on our first visit to NYC. Holiday Inn was a well known name so thought couldnt' go wrong. Very nice hotels, with beautiful rooms, but rooms a bit small, couldn't fit a rollaway for my teenage son. Location is interesting, bordering so many areas, such as Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho. A little quiet in that area at night time. Nothing like staying in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob_italy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one weekend night, the room was on the small side but nice, and for the cost (<200) and the location, definitely a great value.

Reviews.Title: “SoSo in SoHo”
Reviews.Author: TeamZMintHill
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on its location, which was terrific. We were within short walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy, the Brooklyn Bridge, the Financial District, and SoHo. Positive: we were allowed to check in at 9 am without an additional charge; location; the rooms were clean and smoke free. Negative: the breakfast was slow and cold; the rooms were a bit noisy; the lobby was crowded with very loud people; the bathroom amenities were sparse. While there was nothing overwhelmingly wrong with this hotel, there was nothing outstandingly right. I am certain I will not remember my stay here in 3 months. This was a forgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good substitute”
Reviews.Author: MsTrinaWilliams
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at the holiday inn soho when the courtyard Marriott notified us that they were overbooked and moved our reservation to the holiday inn. I was nervous because I hadn't done any research on this hotel. When we arrived we were checked in promptly and given our keys. The room was clean and cozy. It was a little small, but being a new Yorker and knowing the city this is expected. The beds comfy, the room clean, shower was relaxing. My only complaint is that the bathroom is tiny and I had to stand in the space next to the toilet to close the door. There is free breakfast, a bar in the lobby that has $5 drinks during happy hour. You are in Chinatown, but a short cab ride (about $15 to times square) or train ride (Q train is on the corner) can get u to major attractions. There is a McDonald's, burger king, Popeyes, and Starbucks nearby. I was pleased with venue (but I'm a big fan of Chinatown and the cheap shops in the area).

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing, horrible bellman”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and probably had the most horrible room (I hope so!). The front desk was really welcoming and efficient; they even printed some documents for us. When we arrived in the room, there were towels on the floor in the bathroom and already a flooding! The room was in really bad condition and noisy until 2:00am. The bellman at the entrance was really rude. He yelled at us several times, and looked at us like if we were annoying him. When we asked him "Where can we buy meds in the area?", he answered "I don't know". We talked a little bit more with other tourists and they also experienced issues with him. They told us he was Chinese and did not want to speak to tourists. We did not understand the relation between claiming his culture and not being welcoming. We have never seen such a bad reception in our life; this is probably the worst Holiday Inn across America. I think in any self-respecting hotel, an employee with a reception as cold and unpleasant to the visitor could not stay longer than 24 hours in the team. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone and will let know Holiday Inn about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: maria c
Reviews.Content: I am from out of state and before booking the room I called the hotel asking where they were located and they said Times Square. I went out walking to get to times square and found out it was four miles away, i didnt know how to use the subway system and once the hotel parks your car you cannot move it. It took me four hotels to get back to my hotel!!!!!!!!! and the breakfast is 20$ a person, rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn SoHo”
Reviews.Author: msrosied
Reviews.Content: Stayed in So Ho for a long weekend. The rooms were small, but we weren't in them enough to care. I think most of them are in New York. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable. A little street noise but not too much. Location was good. I would stay there again. Price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for your second visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: BcnFrancesc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at thw HI Soho for one week and everything was ok. We were not disappointed at the room simplicity, because you know you get what you pay in big tourist destinations like NY. The best thing about this hotel is definitely its location. I would recommend this hotel for people who already stayed in the mainstream, Uptown NY once, and who are now willing to experience a more real Downtown NY. For a nice budget breakfast or lunch, don't miss the Landmark eatery, located on Lafayette/Grand, within a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They dare you to rate them as excellent”
Reviews.Author: JulesLGB
Reviews.Content: But then refuse to follow through on the little things that they promise. I normally hate to be so critical, but I spent a full seven nights here and didn't get two simple things fixed when requested. One, just wanted some toothpaste, which they promise they'll have if you've forgotten it. They do not plan to have this, though. I know I can go out and get toothpaste on my own, but it's irritating that every day they say they'll have it for you. Even after I went out and got my own I asked them, just to see about it, and they never had it. Second, one channel consistently didn't come in clearly (NBC). They sent an "engineer" up the first night who said he'd get it to work. But clearly he was just hoping I'd check out the next night and not notice that it was not clearer. It was never clearer. When we complained about this to the front desk, nothing happened. Finally, I called the chain's online number, waited 10 minutes, and finally talked to someone who told me I should wait on hold until they transferred me to the front desk of the hotel I was at. But... What? That's why I'm calling this number! Because the front desk does not care! Whatever. I hardly ever write bad reviews, but this is super annoying for such a long stay. For the simplest things, just go out and get the freaking toothpaste instead of telling me that I can go around the corner to get it. As for NBC, just figure it out! I can't be the only guest who would like to watch NBC without static.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at a Wonderful Hotel (Repeat Guest)”
Reviews.Author: Vinny067
Reviews.Content: This review will cover primarily my most recent 7-day stay, which was from Nov. 4 through Nov. 11, 2011. This stay was about my seventh (or sixth, or eighth; I can no longer keep track. ...!) lengthy stay (each from 8 days to 14 days in length) at this hotel since September of 2010. I have already posted at least 3 earlier reviews (all of them very positive), each for earlier stays at this hotel on this website, and, in fact, at least one or two of those earlier reviews of the hotel are no longer available on the site, because they were so old that they were rolled/scrolled into some dim and dusty archive at the Trip Advisor website! BTW, I have just noticed that Trip Advisor has reently changed the names of the categories for type of stay that reviewers are asked to pick, and under this newer classification system, each of my many stays would qualify, for Type of Stay (aka "What Sort of Trip Was This?"), as both Business and Solo stays. I love this hotel and, whenever I come to Manhattan for my consulting work, I always stay ONLY in this hotel. While part of my reason for staying here so faithfully and repeatedly has to do with the location, which is in lower SoHo and in close proximity to Chinatown, Little Italy, LES, and TriBeCa, the simple reality is that there are a number of good hotels available in this same area, and thus I could easily choose to stay at one of those other hotels if I wished to do so, but I find that I consistently keep coming back to this same hotel again and again. Why? I like the rooms, which are clean and comfortable, I enjoy the staff, who seem to be uniformly happy in their work and good at their jobs, I like the lobby area (which is located on the second floor), and I have never had any significant problems during ANY of my numerous and rather lengthy stays here. I finally got around to using the hotel restaurant repeatedly during this most recent stay, and I ate breakfast there on five mornings, and also ordered dinnertime meals twice from it, and in each of those cases, I found the service to be prompt and attentive, and the food to be of very high quality. I can also state with confidence that I will continue, in the future, to stay only at this hotel whenever I am in Manhattan. From this vantage point (that is, early March 2012) it now looks like my next visit to Manhattan will be a 10-day stay in late April 2012, and I will once again be booking my stay at this property! In closing, I would like to extend a big "Thank you" to all the line staff and to the managers of the Holiday Inn Soho NYC for all of my wonderful stays so far! sincerely, -Vinny

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYgal2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, everyone friendly, lots of shops and brand name stores nearby, subway around the corner for easy access to everywhere, very reasonable prices, would definitively stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kfron_8
Reviews.Content: My 16 yr. old daughter and I spent 5 nights here and loved it! Very conveniently located for Soho shopping, Little Italy, and China Town. It was great to walk out the hotel door and be right where you wanted to be. We found the hotel to be clean, and all the staff we came into contact with were very friendly and helpful. We did have an issue with the television, we called the front desk and they sent an engineer to our room, and it was fixed within 15 minutes. The room service breakfast was very good. However, I can't say the same for the burger i had ordered. The burger was a very thick one, and that is okay, but it was way over cooked and very dry; it was a total waste of money. We were on the 11th floor across from the elevators. We could hear the subway, but could not feel it, it really didn't bother us all that much. Another reviewer mentioned that Little Italy was disappointing. Well, it is only two blocks these days as China Town is taking over. The two blocks of Little Italy are great, the only disappointment is that there is not more of it. The taxi ride, with tip, to Time Square ranged from $16-$20 if you are wondering. Well, we had a great time, loved the hotel, staff, and location. Yes, the room was a bit small, but I understand this is normal in NYC. Besides, we were hardly in it for any length of time other than sleeping. This was our first trip to NYC, and we will definately be returning and staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: AsylumGal
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore! Chinatown, Little Italy, Canal street...good starting point for seeing that part of town. Stephen at the front desk was so welcoming and personable! Everyone there was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, really comfy bed and a screaming hot shower! I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, decent location”
Reviews.Author: MikeC_2006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a handy central location close to China Town and the Italian quarter in New York City. The blaring music in the front entrance is a bit odd! Room was average (tiny double beds, but a decent bathroom and half-decent shower). The included buffet breakfast was ok - but sausages were cold, bacon was cold, scrambled egg was cold, bagels were stale (and when I asked for fried egg instead of scrambled, I was told this wasn't possible - strange!). Bar and restaurant were rather soul-less, but I guess you should treat this hotel as a relatively low-cost place to spend the night in New York, rather than anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades Needed”
Reviews.Author: Daisy M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a girls' weekend. The size of the rooms were fine and the price was reasonable but there were some mechanical issues which need to be addressed. First the toilet did not flush correctly -- have to hold the handle down to flush; the electricity kept blowing a circuit while trying to dry our hair; the telephone did not work and we needed to go into the hallway to call; alarm clock did not function properly and the mattresses and pillows need to be changed up. Manager would not speak to our party regarding some of the issues but could be seen coming in and out of the back of the desk multiple times. Not too good with customer service so I can see....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mjcohen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Room and it was phenomenal. I would have paid double what I did! The manager was fantastic, service was impeccable, room was clean and spacious. Strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Binibunch
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend trip for my daughter and I, so this was a quick last minute choice. Great selection, I must admit. The location is perfect for shopping on Canal and Broadway streets, 1 block from the subway, and plentiful restaurants. The hotel is not exactly in Soho, but not far at all. Tribeca and China town was nearby as well. The rooms are small but cozy and contemporary...it's NYC! We were on the 7th floor, couldn't hear any noise if we wanted to..we were too exhausted! The staff was friendly and helpful. We were even allowed to check in 3 hours early. The bellman gave us helpful tips on getting around the city so we just grabbed a map at the first floor front desk and hit the subway. Cab fare should be no more than $30 from Laguardia, ask for a running cab rate, no Flat Rate....it's a hustle. We did Time Square, Theatre District (saw an awesome play), Empire State Building, Harlem...all for $2.25 per ride. The hotel's location is super convenient, clean and decent. If you're looking for these qualities, this is the hotel to be!!

Reviews.Title: “teeny,tiny shoebox room !”
Reviews.Author: shalovesny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two teenage kids (16 and 13) spent our first 2 nights in New York at The Holiday Inn Soho NYC in October 2010. We chose the hotel as my hubby is a priority club member and had points to use - our first chice was the Intercontinental Times Square which is still part of the HI group but the first 2 nights of our stay was not available there- hence our stay at the HI Soho. The Hotel was nice and clean,but in need of a little updating. The main public areas - reception ,(which was situated on the first floor up an escalator) were quite modern and bright but the room we had was a little dark with just an old fashioned sash style window,- (to be fair though an amazing view of the Empire State Building - which was the first thing we looked at through said window on the night we arrived , it was all lit up in red and green lights -Magical ! - and it was also the first thing I looked at the next morning in the early morning sunlight) We did request quite a while before our trip that we were in need of a bigger corner room as we were a family of 4 - I even checked out the hotels official website to view some of their bigger rooms - but the one we had was tiny. the main problem was the passage way into the room was also the space to store clothes etc. Because we were only there for the 2 nights ,we did not bother unpacking and just settled for delving in and out of the case for the short space of time that we were there- which was just as well as we would have struggled more I think if we had tried to find space for the four of us to store our clothes ,coats,shoes and suitcases - we even had to put one case in the bathroom so that we could move around the room in a normal fashion !. The room would be ok for a couple , and great if you have been to NY before and want to concentrate on downtown area. Its a good location for Little Italy,Chinatown,Financial District and Soho and LES - also handy for a stroll over the Brooklyn Bridge -all walkable if you enjoy a stroll and soaking up the NYC atmosphere on foot but you will need to subway or taxi to midtown or further.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - don't expect frills!”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: The location is good - disagree with those who say it isn't. You're five minutes walk from great shopping and the cool feel of Soho and a bit further on from Greenwich Village and Bowery. Unless you think New York is just Fifth Avenue and Times Square - in which case you're far away and should check in midtown. This hotel is basic and the communal areas are a bit faded. But it's a base to venture out from, not a hotel to spend time in. Rooms are clean, if small - couldn't actually open my chest of drawers because my bed was in the way! Bathrooms OK. Staff friendly. Price very competitive for the area. I'd use it again. Just be realistic - it is what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, excellent location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Labienus67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated, at the border of Little Italy (to be avoided, gigantic tourist trap), Chinatown and the chic boutiques and restaurants of Soho. There is a nearby subway station (you hear the subway and you feel the vibrations in the rooms). The rooms are okay, reasonably sized, there is free coffee and tea, the bathroom is good, with perfectly working appliances and hot water at all times, and you find a small coffee shop, an ATM and a cosy lobby within the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Room rates are reasonable for New York, but do not forget the State Tax, the City Tax, the Occupancy Tax ! This hotel can be recommended without any restriction.

Reviews.Title: “They could do better...”
Reviews.Author: MCosta1348
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business, and you get your usual NYC hotel experience. The rooms are smallish, and appeared to have been remodeled, which I deemed a plus. However, there were 2 noticeable gaffs... Cable TV...out of service during the NFL playoff games on Sunday night...no excuses here... My 5AM wakeup call.....never happened... With luck, I woke up on my own that morning. I might return here, but I'm also going to shop around a bit more next time..

Reviews.Title: “This place has gotten worse.”
Reviews.Author: LWidget76
Reviews.Content: This place has gotten a lot worse over the past 2 years, just to start. - Upon arrival I was checked in by a front desk agent names Steven. This process of my stay went smooth and I was granted everything my reservation was. I notice the design of the rooms have been upgraded and have a nice feel to them, although they are still very tiny. With my 2 night stay BOTH of those nights the tv in my room had major issues. When I contacted the front desk about it I was told that a engineer would be sent to my room to check out the issue. When the engineer arrived I was told that there was nothing they can do, its a bigger problem there having with the network. I was told by another person staying at the hotel whom I met over the stay, that her TV was working just fine. So I decided to ask for a change Of room and was declined by a front desk agent saying "sorry I can't help you because we are sold out for the next 2 days" It's a bit of a bummer when your paying all this money and can't even watch basic television at the end of your day. Beside the tv incident, I also wouldn't reccomend any room service or food from their restaurant. Not only is it over priced, but it's just horrible food all together. Although you probably wouldn't notice with all the food trays laying outside of people's rooms in the hallways all day. (gave my floor a horrible smell) Im sure I can keep on with a lot of things I notice getting worse with this place since my last stay. In closing though, I will say the location is what keeps this hotel alive. I doubt I will be returning to this hotel any time soon. Ps. Stay away from Abby the Bellhop (VERY pushy individual)

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive but clean”
Reviews.Author: darnellgd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Fri-Sat on Christmas sightseeing tour of NYC. King room was small with only one chair. We had to walk sideways between dresser and bed. Restaurant and bar not open till 5 PM and closed at 10 PM. So much for a night cap after the Rocketts show. They ran out of eggs at the $20 breakfast buffet on Sunday for 30 minutes. Neighborhood on border of Chinatown was run down but close to the subway for those who know how to use it. We used cabs and a personal tour guide to get around because wife was in wheelchair. I'll look somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: harrow-sports
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in china town and was clean and customer friendly. Within blocks of the metro lines, we had access to any part of NYC, which we spent most of our time in uptown and Greenwich. Santakan weekend, what a riot!!! The hotel was exactly 17 miles from JFK and on our Sunday morning cab ride took about 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Jeff Y
Reviews.Content: The location is great a short walk from Little Italy and and even shorter walk from the shopping on lower Boardway. The subway is a short walk away and about 10 mins ride to Times Square. Heater in the room was very very loud and if you didn't have it on the room froze. Bar closed at 10.30 everynight and they appeared to switch off the cable tv so unable to watch the Knicks v Lakers game. Room was quite small. All said I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and odd location”
Reviews.Author: lenusvyat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in decent conditions but the location - while close to the subway - is quite odd. Surrounded by nothing other than Chinatown. Rooms are absolutely tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in the area”
Reviews.Author: nuclearsun
Reviews.Content: Typically I stay further uptown or Times Square, but this location worked out well as I had meetings off mullberry st and was able to park ($55 valet) and walk. Local resturants made dinner easy and the rooms are standard NYC chain rooms. Did have an issue at check in, my key opened the door of my already occupied room....the shower was running, so no interaction with inside occupants, but definately not what I expected. The front desk corrcted that issue and moved me to a room with king bed and view of Canal st.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Matsibi
Reviews.Content: Great time in NYC! This was our third time to this hotel. We reserved a king executive suite and after being moved 3 times were finally told that the room we reserved was not available. Despite some initial frustration, you can't beat the location. Two blocks from Little Italy, A block from the subway sand a short walk to Greenwich village.

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise In Soho”
Reviews.Author: RangersNY
Reviews.Content: When I was booked to the Holiday Inn, I thought "Ugh, it's gonna be an old dingy hotel". I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was tastefully decorated, the room was clean, and the bed was great. The buffet breakfast had a decent selection and every staff member I encountered at this hotel was friendly and helpful. It's also hard to beat the location. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean - convenient to Court and subway”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen14220
Reviews.Content: Traveled to NYC with husband and 12 year old daughter. Had a meeting at Manhattan Family Court. Location was very convenient to the courthouse - 10 minute walk. Could also walk to Little Italy, which we did for dinner. Midtown/Times Square, etc. was a short subway ride away. Subway station was practically right outside the hotel. Stayed on an upper floor. Room was spacious enough and very clean. Had a wonderful buffet breakfast which was not included in the rate but was reasonable and plentiful. At $189.00 per night for 2 queen beds, you really can't beat this value. Will definitely stay here again - whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrancisLeroy
Reviews.Content: Really 3.5 In Chinatown, close to SoHo. Small room, but what do you expect. Clean and functional, good bathroom. Did hear the subway, but not annoyingly so. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation Does Not Make A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: javababy
Reviews.Content: I don't know what this hotel was like before the renovation, but I'd be hard-pressed to define what work had been done. It still looked a bit sad and slightly depressing. My room came with a King bed which left about a foot between the bed and desk -- just enough room to swing the chair sideways in order to get out of it -- so I changed the room to a Queen bed. Same problem. The TV was still analog, causing HBO to appear fuzzy. The clock radio did not work and had to be replaced. No instructions came with the replacement (or the TV) so Maintenance told me to call the operator for a Wake-up. The heater was too loud to keep on so I froze during the night and wound up sleeping dressed The other reason I didn't sleep well for 3 nights was the Subway rumbling every 15-20 minutes. The subway is a block away. Convenient, unless sleep is on your agenda. There were no amenities ... no shower cap, no conditioner, no stationery, no envelopes. The towels were rough as sand paper. Didn't they ever hear of Bounce Free? There was 1/4 of a small writing pad. There was also coffee and tea packets with a plug-in carafe. The coffee was undrinkable. Fearing the tea was the same I bought my own tea bags. About those paper thin walls ... that was the last thing I needed to complete my sleepless nights. The people in the next room chose to shower at 3:30 am. Why I was able to hear the shower is a mystery to me. Minor point: On arrival and departure the Bellman did not offer to help with my luggage. No, I do not recommend this hotel unless everything else in the area is booked.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could rate it less...”
Reviews.Author: Krievadiva
Reviews.Content: Let's see, where do I begin? I booked a room at this property through Hotels.com...on a side note, my husband always uses them to book his hotels & usually has a positive experience. Since this was a last minute trip, I was more than thrilled at the $159 a night price (excluding the exorbitant $35 tacked on for taxes...). I personally called Hotels.com to book the room as I was using my husband's account and wanted to make sure all was well. The gentleman I spoke with seemed competent enough & confirmed my reservation for a NON SMOKING room. You probably can see where I'm going with this, yes?! Fast forward to our arrival where I am waiting in the lobby to check-in...I cannot help but eavesdrop on the couple ahead of us, they too had booked on Hotels.com & were given their NON SMOKING room. Once I check-in and head to our room, imagine my surprise at being given a smoking room. Here's the thing: I am don't care if you smoke, I am not that uptight. The issue (besides the fact that I requested a non-smoking room), is that I have severe allergies and it truly compromises my breathing. I call the front desk to explain the situation and he informs me that my reservation is 'as is', meaning I have no flexibility to change it + they have no other rooms available. Oh, and he was beyond rude...basically like tough luck, I have your credit card and that's that. Nothing infuriates me more! I call hotels.com and they also inform me tough luck, ugh. I have no choice but to suck it up and stay the night & I wake up in the morning with bites all over my back---YUCK! Do mot stay here, it is disgusting. There is a Hilton Garden Inn in Tribeca that is in the same price range, stay there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job....”
Reviews.Author: alan l
Reviews.Content: .....for a couple of weeks whilst I was in NY on business. Location was the best feature with easy access to main subway and with loads of good places to eat. The hotel receptionists were good fun as were the ladies who served the really filling breakfasts. Couldn't get a decent wifi connection in my room but the foyer area was ok. The rooms themselves were small (it is NY after all) but everything worked and overall I'd recommend as a sensible good value option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ledothoil
Reviews.Content: Great location, yes, it's more Chinatown than Soho but certainly convenient for Soho and Little Italy. A great part of the city to stay in. Reception staff weren't overly welcoming and I couldn't check out an hour late as I wanted. As a platinum priority club member staying on reward nights I was offered a couple of free drinks at the bar. Rooms okay, I stayed on the 13th floor, quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmd_757
Reviews.Content: I'll do this very simply: 1. Outstanding location. 2. Very nice room (high ceilings, clean, cool windows, tons of light, nice details.). 3. Friendly and attentive service. 4. Very reasonable price. We loved it and will definitely return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we would want”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, Staff are attentive, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: cassijensen
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, one queen bed, but we were amazed by the view of NYC from our 12th story window, truly amazing. It was as though you had the whole city at your feet! Dinner was just ok, nothing special. We also ate breakfast there, and it was fine. Service was good both meals. It's both Soho and Chinatown, depending on which direction you walk. I had a good rate, and over all, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much when I checked into this hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised by the lobby cleanliness and receptionist was very polite. The hotel is just next to Chinatown, which I like! Plenty of Cantonese restaurants on Mott Street to choose from. The standard room with queen bed was really small, but that goes the same for nearly all the hotels on this island. I left my ring next to the sink when I checked out. I called the hotel 30 minutes later, the receptionist notified the cleaning crew right away. In the afternoon I went back to the Holiday Inn Soho to retrieve the ring, they put it in an envelope with my name on it. Kudos to the great service!

Reviews.Title: “It's more like Holiday Inn Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoeat86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me for business, but I saw the group rate they were giving us ~170 US a night. Contrary to the name, this hotel is not actually in SoHo, but more like in Chinatown (what other reviewers have said). I found it quieter than expected (as long as you have the air conditioner/fan off). Yes the rooms are pretty small, but I didn't expect that much considering it's NYC. I found the room reasonably clean and the furnishings/facilities to be relative new and updated. You can definitely feel the subway going underneath the building and it makes you bed vibrate ever so slightly.... I actually kind of liked this! The service was pleasant. I would consider staying here again, but if the price was higher than I'd have to bump my rating down to a 3.... at the point it would be what I'd expect or very average for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: Linyo
Reviews.Content: The facility was spotless. Every staff person we encountered had a pleasant and sincere greeting, and we had no problems or issues at check in or check out. We had a great room that was very spacious for New York standards. We could not have been happier with our stay, and will return here the next time our business takes us to this part of Manhattan. And, instead of the mediocre restaurants a couple of blocks away in Little Italy, try Parigot, just down the street on the corner of Layfayette and Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay/bad service”
Reviews.Author: natchee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in October for business. This hotel was in a GREAT location for the subway - so close to the N/Q/R/W line, the 6 line, and a short walk to the A/C/E and 1/2/3 line., even the J line. The service on the other hand, left something to be desired. As I was checking in, there was a fairly big line up of people but as a platnium priority member, I took advantage of the priority line. The staff seemed very overwhelmed during the whole process and a bit flustered with so many guests. The bellmen downstairs were lovely and greeted me each time I walked into the hotel. I have no complaints about the room - I was up high and didn't have issues with hot water or anything like that. The room was small, but that's NYC. The most frustrating experience with this hotel was the internet service. It was so slow every day I was there that I ended up going to the Starbucks around the corner to use THEIR free wifi. I called the front desk who offered to send an engineer up to *my room* to fix the router (there is no router in my room) and was also offered a number to call tech support. There was absolutely nothing that tech support could do for me aside from fix the internet with the HOTEL, not my computer. I was also told that when the hotel is fully booked, it slows it down "a bit." It wasn't slowed down "a bit" - it did not work AT ALL. If you're going to offer free wifi as an amenity at the hotel, make sure it works WHEN THERE ARE GUESTS STAYING THERE. The front desk offered nothing to help and as a business traveller, I cannot express how frustrating this was. That ruined it for me - I would do my best to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jacque K
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say that my stay at the Holiday Inn was fabulous, but needless to say it was not. The staff lost our credit card payments, charged our personal cards that were given for incidentals (after they were instructed not to), and proceeded not to let us have a key to our room for 2 hours. The water was cold for over 24 hours and I took 2 cold showers. I discovered that folks that were checking in that day were not informed that there was no hot water. Sounds like great customer service doesn't it? The next evening I went to the counter to verify some information and was greeted with, "What do you need to check on?" The gentleman acted as if we had put him out with his sarcastic tone. The gym was small, which is not a bad thing, but equipment was grimy and needed to be fine detailed. There was grime in the edges of the pockets that hold water bottles and the towel hamper had not been removed from the day before. It still held all the old towels. The hotel staff is not consistent in how they handle matters. They run you to the front desk and to the bellman to ask for mail, book extra reservations under your name and charge you for not checking it in, lock you out of your room for 2 hours, then they lose your reservations. Internet is really slow too.

Reviews.Title: “Its not in SoHo but in Chinatown...”
Reviews.Author: FlyingLowLDN
Reviews.Content: ... Which is great if you like fabulous Dim Sum and authentic duck and pancakes, but bot if you actually want to stay in SoHo. The area around the hotel is often dirty with lots of trash on th streets and due to all the traders on the sidewalk it can get a little too crowded. I was not too happy with the location as its billed as soho, while very close, this is not 100% accurate. Subway outside the door and lots to do a short walk away. Rooms were not great, but its hard to find a hotel with great rooms in NY for a sensible price. Service was holiday inn standard. There are better options in NY but for the price, this hotel is good value and fits the bill. (Some of the Chinese restaurants round there by the way look like dumps, but the food is just amazing! Many are open 24h)

Reviews.Title: “No hot water for two days!”
Reviews.Author: johnellett
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location before. It is convenient to the subway, Chinatown and the financial district. It has pleasant staff and is clean. But not being able to take a hot shower for two days in a row does not make for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: nicgrice81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn SoHo from 9/30-10/4. We landed at 10pm at LGA and took a taxi to the hotel ($26 plus tip). Check in was very quick and easy.  Our room was on the 4th floor and we got what we reserved-- standard double room. It was small, modern and updated. The HI website had outdated pics. We were pleasantly surprised! The bathroom had very nice granite counters  The shower had nice water pressure and the shower head was removable and you could change the height too. They also provided Bath and Body Works shampoo, lotion and bar soap. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.  The location was excellent. We were just around the corner from the Canal St./Lafayette or Canal St./Broadway stations. We took the Subway everywhere (7-Day Metrocard was well worth it, even though we only got 4 days use from it). We also walked to the Soho shops, Little Italy and Chinatown. All very close. There are also little gift shops down the steet from the hotel. We preferred the ones closer to Chinatown/Little Italy, where we could haggle/bargain. :) Even my 13 y/o sister was getting good at it. :) All of the staff members we talked to were very nice. We mainly interacted with the bellman staff. The main entrance takes you by their stand and to elevators and the front desk is a short ride up the escalator, on the second floor. We didn't eat at the restaurant or order room service. One thing we would have liked to see --indoor pool or hot tub, but no biggie. We did utilize the luggage hold area. We checked out at 10am and our flight wasn't until 8pm. The bellman put our luggage in the locked storage area just behind the bellman counter. He gave us a claim ticket and we were off to explore more of the city without luggage in tow. We came back around 4pm and picked up our luggage. Overall, the hotel was great. The location was perfect. Service and cleanliness were excellent. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “THANKS BUT NO THANKS”
Reviews.Author: Androulla N
Reviews.Content: When i checked into the hotel that i a;;ready paid for i was asked for a $40.00 dollar deposit, when i asked why, i was told itis incase i damage the room, i wouldnot mind but as a IHG employee it was hightly unlikely When i asked the port for directions to a hop on hop off bus tour bus stop, he sais why did you book with that company they are crap and he didnot know where to pick it up from (what he ment was i should of booked with him so he could get his commission I asked him whyhe was being so rude and he told me it was me that was rude (He was the oriental porter who worked on the 29th of August around 3.30PM) (I WOULD LIKE TO THANK THE HOTEL AND HIM FOR GIVING ME SUCH A FANTASTIC FIRSTIMPRESSION OF NEW YORK) - thats a joke - and least the rest of the other hotels i stayed in were much better and more customer friendly that this one

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was literally the cheapest room at a name-brand hotel in the city for this trip due to a large trade show being in town. At $300+ per night, I was expecting a bit more, but the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the location wasn't at all bad, especially if you like doing a little shopping along Canal Street. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmityL
Reviews.Content: I was weary because it was on Canal St. and more Chinatown than SoHo but it was fine. Not ghetto at all. Very touristy clientele. Good neighborhood actually because it's almost in SoHo. If you need somewhere quick & easy for 1 night this is fine. I stayed because I was going to a party in the neighborhood and just needed somewhere to strictly sleep - not to hang out after or before. Really long check in line though which was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dtanpcs
Reviews.Content: One of your best choices to stay if you plan on visiting NYU or to go shopping in SOHO. It is an easy walk to the shops on Broadway. Its not fancy, but is clean and has reasonable sized rooms (by New York standards). There is a restaurant that serves breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: gioia26
Reviews.Content: This is a nice value, newly redesigned hotel, good location, good service. It is great to be close to Little Italy restaurants, SoHo shops, and Chinatown. It is close to the subway and good shops and restaurants. The concierge was extremely helpful with private airport transportation. There is a health club nearby to use and small workout room in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mick54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights in September as part of our touring holiday. The standards were very good as one expects from a Holiday Inn. The rooms were very comfortable but a little small by normal American standards but this is NYC. We had two good nights rest and heard no noise from other rooms.The staff were good and the restaurant at breakfast was excellent although a full grill was a bit pricey at $24 a go. As mentioned in previous reviews, the location of the hotel was great for restaurants as it was 10 minutes to Little Italy and China Town. Also, near the Canal St. subway and shopping on Broadway. Only one drawback, if you like a late nightcap before bed, the bar closes at 10.30pm sharp. We would return again. Mick and Glen Shaw Newark, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Nishy18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close to the subway, a walk away from Soho, Tribeca (if you like long walks!), Chinatown, Little Italy and Nolita. The staff were always friendly and helpful - giving advise to help our trip be a better one. The room we had was clean and excellent for the location and definately worth the price. I would definately recommend the hotel for everything. if you like a hotel close to everything, and in the middle of action for a good price, this is the hotel foryou.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to the action”
Reviews.Author: AnnonReviewer12345
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the hotel was just blocks away from some amazing restaurants and lots of shopping. Felt much less touristy than hotels near Times Square, but there was still so much to do within walking distance. Room was on the small side but average for NYC standards. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: susan R
Reviews.Content: After our disasterous stay at the Best Western Royal Plaza, Marlborough, MA This hotel was great, super staff, small but very clean and comfortable rooms and although downtown NY very close to Chinatown, Little Italy and subway , would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Correct. Just this.”
Reviews.Author: chmcsouza
Reviews.Content: Correct place to stay if you are looking for something near downtown. Clean and efficient. Just this.

Reviews.Title: “No issues other than room being small”
Reviews.Author: jeff p
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the holiday inn soho september 2011 with my girlfriend and we had no problems during our stay. Wasnt impressed with the room size it was probably around 200sq ft total but thats to be expected downtown. also a double bed is a little small for a taller person but the mattress was comfortable. The hotel is a 1 minute walk to the canal st subway so you can be at times square 42nd or 49th st in a matter of 10 minutes or so. Free Wifi, staff isn't overbearing and harassing but always available to help. I didn't eat at the hotel but there is a good breakfast/lunch place called Bluebird Sky that is a 2 minute walk from the hotel and is pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: YHI2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one day because I woke the next morning with bite marks. The bathroom had mold.

Reviews.Title: “In need for upgrades...”
Reviews.Author: RKMax
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Soho is really close to little Italy, china town and of course soho which makes it convenient to pretty much shop for low end stuff high end stuff and eat good stuff!! On the downside of this hotel is the upgrades so desperately needed. The room was less than average with no space for much. The windows are filthy and the bathroom is need of a scrub down. The amenities ... Well there aren't many ... I didnt even find soap nevermind toothpaste in the bathroom. If it's for a one night stay and don't have any options stay here as long it's for sleep. Oh and by the way you'll be paying for less than 24 hours when you stay here they don't allow you to check in until 3 pm so if your flight comes in early and you want to take a nap think of something else cause they will make you wait in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “noisy and small--ruined trip totally before mold in shower”
Reviews.Author: KevinInAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This room was tiny, just an alcove. Terrible. Window AC. YUK. There was twenty seven inches to the dresser from the adequate twin bed. The other closet for hanging clothes was too small to have a door. Walls were pleasant with heavy wallpaper to cover defects.Bathroom was adequate, except for mold. Aircondition was a small but adequate 5000 BTU unit. When it ran most of the street noise such as trucks, and fire engines was covered up. Turning the AC off revealed a terrible world of subway trains grinding their rails, and traffic. Shower had lots of black mold on the grout. The reception woman was very professional. There was a coffee maker. I will take a sleeping pilll tonight and be glad that I sleep in another country next time I go to bed. OH. Free WIFI is available. Always one good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: rich044
Reviews.Content: Came here for a week and had a great stay, started off in a very run down ex-smoking room which smelt awful, however we were given a different room the next day which was lovely, and couldn't have been cleaner. Very spacious for new york and had some good views. The location is the best thing about this hotel, it's right in the thick of the action with lots of interesting bars and restaurants around the area. Tubes are not far away very cheap. When we return you new york we will definitely stay here again. Thanks holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 420Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is going through a major renovation, though you will not know it is going on. I love a renovated hotel and Holiday Inn didn't let me down. Before my arrival, I called the hotel and requested a quiet floor away from noise, such as an elevator. They granted my request and put me in a corner room. My room had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room itself was perfect for me. The air conditioning was outstanding! I loved coming back after a long day to feel the temperature of the room. The beds are extremely comfortable. I called to have more pillows delivered and they are brought to my room in five minutes. The room smelled like brand new construction. Carpet and interiors were beautiful -- I loved my experience. The hotel is located near the Canal and Lafayette intersection. I used the 6 train a lot to get place to place. Though it is nearer to Chinatown, I walked to Soho several times. I found the location to be outstanding! The hotel lobby is located on the second floor. Having fresh flavored water on check in was a nice feature! I also liked the opportunity to have a late check out, since I was a priority club member. Wifi in the room is free! Fitness center is located on the first floor/ground level. Seemed nice, though I didn't use it. Bar/restaurant on the second floor. Didn't use that either. If you are looking for a quiet floor, stay on an odd numbered floor. Ice machines are on the even floors. I found my room to be quiet and comfortable. Without a doubt, I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place- perfect location and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: SMarshall_001
Reviews.Content: Considering that hotels in NYC are outrageously expensive, it is a breath of fresh air to find a really nice, reasonably priced, clean hotel with friendly staff in a great part of the city. The rooms have recently been updated and are clean, comfortable, and relaxing! The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable- the pillows were even labeled with ribbons as either "firm" or "soft"! It was very hot while we were there, so it was a bonus to have AC worked well to quickly cool the room, and it was not loud at all. There was even some renovations going on in the building that I wouldn't have even known about except that I ran into a very friendly worker in the elevator. We couldn't hear a thing! Valet parking is pricey- $55.00 a day, but this is apparently to be expected in Manhattan. Most people don't drive the NYC anyway! The subway system is easily within walking distance as are several sites to visit such as SoHo shopping, Greenwich Village, Ground Zero, and the Brooklyn Bridge. I loved my stay here, and I don't have a singly complaint or negative comment to make about this property. I highly recommend this hotel to like-minded, adventurous people who can't afford to spend a fortune on a hotel in Manhattan. As an FYI- not related to the property: do not take the M60 bus to LaGuardia as I did after reading online that it is an inexpensive alternative to taking a shuttle. The M60 goes straight through Harlem, stops at every little stop along the way, and the locals are none too happy to see travelers with luggage on their main busline. It got very ugly a couple times with several of the aggressive local bus riders and I felt unsafe for the first time in many years of traveling the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: scl28970
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was a great location and a good value--walking distance to multiple subway lines and tons of great shopping/restaurant options. It's a great location if you want to spend most of your time in places like Chinatown, SoHo, and Little Italy, but it's also easy to head uptown to Central Park and over to Brooklyn. It's not the fanciest place, but when you're in NYC you mostly just need a clean, comfortable place to sleep--this place definitely gives you that. The one down side was that there was some noise in the early morning hours, when we could hear a lot of door slamming, and one random noise that sounded like someone was filling about 15 ice buckets in a row every morning. The latter is my biggest complaint; the noise may have been worse given the particular location of our room, so we probably could have asked to change rooms--but it wasn't bad enough for us to go through the trouble. Overall, a good place and I'd definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff. Out of date. Check charges with your card company.”
Reviews.Author: alive60745
Reviews.Content: I was charged separately over $3200 without my knowledge for a 3 day AAA stay.The final charge for $1973 was done when I was no longer staying there. I only found this out when my card was declined in another city while I was trying to pay for breakfast. It took over 4 hours to get this straighened up over the phone. The manager was not helpful in that I had to keep calling her back either because she hung up or she said to call her back. My credit card company was not impressed. H I customer support helped. Hotel staff were great. No brandy or Absolute Vodka at the bar but amazing peanut butter and jelly sandwiches were specially made when the kitchen closed. Thank you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Hard and crunchy on the outside, soft and luxurious on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Canadian09876
Reviews.Content: Not the best area, we got this place via Priceline, so we didn't get to choose the locale. Chinatown was not our top choice, for sure. It was far from the subways (well, for Manhattan... it wasn't THAT far) and for Manhattan it was an... undesirable location. We wanted something a bit closer to actual SoHo or the East Village or Chelsea. HOWEVER, the inside made up for ALL of that. The room was really, really nice! The room was HEEE-UGE for Manhattan standards, or any standards really. The bed was plush, the sheets were soft and crisp (how do they do that? I can never get my sheets to do that) and the bathroom was big. Everything was spotless. Staff was really friendly... Just trust me: this place does everything right!

Reviews.Title: “great to be in a clean hotel - good price and great staff”
Reviews.Author: phadreus
Reviews.Content: this was great value and great area to see nyc from

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Employees, Very Clean and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: silvershakti
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC in April with my teenage daughter to visit colleges and we chose this hotel to stay at sight unseen, but we liked the sound of where it was located. Well the location couldn't have been better-within a block of both Soho and Chinatown/Little Italy, and a subway stop at the opposite end of the street. We arrived early via Megabus, and asked them to store our luggage while we roamed the city. Not only did the do so nicely (not making us feel like we were inconveniencing them) they also made sure we had a chance to use the restroom as well. Once we checked in, the room itself was very clean though a little small, but who spends time in their hotel room in NYC? The free in-room wireless was also a plus. Any time we needed help with anything, it didn't matter who we asked - everyone was willing to please-whether it was to give us additional directions to different neighborhoods, or to accommodatingly provide us with additional towels, my daughter and I were both very pleased during our stay. Tho breakfast wasn't included (there was an on-site restaurant) there were several chain coffee shops (D&D, Starbucks) as well as a couple grocery stores within a block or two of the hotel, which made our morning meal cheaper and quicker. Because of the location, staying close to the hotel one evening was still an adventure, because within two blocks, we were in Little Italy enjoying great Italian food and stores. I have already told several people about this hotel find - and hope to use it again on my return trips!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location. Right in the heart of China Town.”
Reviews.Author: _My_Experiences_999
Reviews.Content: King-size room (room 906) is smaller than a twice queen-size bed room (room 910, 911). Rooms have window air conditioning. But it keep the room cool enough. Room is nice enough and a little small. But you are in New York, don't spend too much time in the room. Get a hotel car service to LGA airport. Much cheaper than a cab and in a luxury car. Flat rate is $34. May also want to coordinate a pickup from the air port, if they offer. Hotel is in the heart of China Town, a couple of blocks from Little Italy. It is on a large, clean street. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and staff”
Reviews.Author: apenguingal
Reviews.Content: I completely enjoy staying at the Holiday Inn in SoHo. The staff are the friendly variety that make you feel wanted and appreciated. The rooms are very simple, which is all that is needed in a city that you should not miss by staying in your room. Even housekeeping is polite and helpful, and offer you whatever you should want or need if you approach them. The whole experience is topped off by the most pleasant bellhops you could ask for. They are superb and are willing to go above and beyond for you. I will continue to stay here as long as I continue to visit the city. Well done again, Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfy!”
Reviews.Author: dcoldsmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn New York Soho for a quick visit. It was optimally located just a block from the subway and near many, many shops and restaurants! The hotel is clean and the beds are soooo comfortable. As a matter of fact, I called to see where I could get the pillows and they are shipping this week! Can't wait! Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in New York's best neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: w_b_eurlings
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel twice last month. Both stays were great. The hotel is located on the border of Little Italy, Chinatown and Soho!!! just walk a few blocks in whatever direction and you are in the middle of all action. Metrostops just around the corner wich brings you uptown. The staffmembers are all very friendly and willing to help you if you have a problem or a question. Stephen at front desk checked us in both times and did this very good. Each hotel in NY should need an employee like him. If you need transportation to JFK or Laguardia don't take a taxi!! Go to the bellmen and ask them. They can provide transportation for you which is cheaper than a taxi!!!!! I just can't say anything negative about the hotel. It's really a great hotel with very professional staff. Compliments!!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Met”
Reviews.Author: Chi_Road-Tripper
Reviews.Content: We landed at Holiday Inn Soho after having to leave a sub-par hotel in the Times Square area. I have never been so happy to see a Holiday Inn! The price was competitive. The rooms were small-ish (not tiny), clean, and comfortable. The front desk staff was absolutely superb. The hotel is near the N/Q stop. It's a stone's throw from Little Italy (where we had a fantastic dinner), and it's near Broadway, which has lots of great shops. You have to travel to get Uptown, but trains are quick and taxis are easy to catch there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Novabllue
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 2 nights here and everything was wonderful! EVERY member of the staff was so friendly & helpful. The Bellmen practically ran to take care of anything you asked & the desk staff were quick to give you a map with directions to anywhere you needed to go. Breakfast was good....and again, the waitstaff was fabulous. As a matter of fact, on our last day there, we popped into the restaurant for a quick sandwich before we headed home. We ordered a club sandwich & it turned out they had no lettuce to put on it. No big deal.....the chef came out of the kitchen to apologize & give us a cup of the soup he had just made. It was a rich tomato soup......delicious! Just an example of great customer service! Room was very clean....just a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, decent hotel for NYC”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityTarheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights--near Chinatown and Little Italy so lots of good eats nearby. Hotel is a decent price and quality for staying in Manhattan. My only major complaint is that the single queen room I had was tiny and the desk chair my only recourse for sitting in the room if I didn't want to be in the bed. Breakfast buffet was pretty good, but you are in NYC so it's pricey. I would stay here again, especially if the trip was only a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: capitalgull
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the HI Soho-Lafayette and had no problems with the hotel at all. It is well positioned near the hustle of Canal Street, which is on a number of subway lines, but the room we stayed in was quiet (12th floor). Good bed, decent bathroom and facilities were fine. Staff was very polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tabmab
Reviews.Content: Went to NY with a friend for a girls getaway and we searched through many hotels. We really did not want to spend a fortune and did not plan on being in our room much. Room was small as stated in other reviews but enough for me and my friend. We had a standard double room. Room was clean and staff were friendly. The bellmen were excellent and always offered assistance. This is a great locataion for Canal Street, Little Italy. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel except for scratched car in parking deck”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Soho for one night on August 6, 2010. I thought the hotel was in a great location close to NYU and Chinatown. There are lots of great restaurants in Little Italy and Chinatown within walking distance. I was driving so I decided to use the hotel parking that cost about 55 dollars. The room was decent sized for a NYC hotel room. The bed was fine. One strange thing was a phone in the bathroom that made a strange noise. Another thing was I wasn't a fan of the cable selection but there was free wi-fi. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and the breakfast buffet was pretty decent. It was better than most express type hotels. When I went to check out the next day I noticed a scratch and dent on the left rear driver's side of my Honda Civic. I went back inside of the hotel to let them know that my car was damaged in the parking deck. When I arrived home I contacted the hotel and after a month or so they said it wasn't their responsibility. They told me to contact David at Wooster Parking. After months of calling and emailing he claimed they weren't responsible for anything. The estimates to repair the damage to my car are between 700 and 1200 dollars but I was offered nothing for this damage. I still enjoyed my stay and everything was fine except for the damage to my car. I'm still going to recommend the hotel but don't ever let them park your car.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharging their customers”
Reviews.Author: MelboourneTravelBee
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel's description is deceptive - hotel is in Chinatown and not Soho; there is a business center but it is not complimentary. Secondly, the hotel places a 'holding amount' on your credit card, as well as charging the amount of your stay to your credit card. In my case, they held $300 and also charged the amount of my stay which was $1620 (for 10 days). I checked out 5 days ago and still have not received the $300 holding amount back. Extremely dissatisfied with this hotel. The staff are very unfriendly and abrupt. I have now moved to a midtown hotel with a better reputation, location, and a fridge!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best location”
Reviews.Author: pancho2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights from new years' eve with superior room. 1. Room size: very small. it feels like 20 square meter. yet bathroom is large for this room with bathtub. Good size for single traveler, Too small for double use. 2. Bed: Very big and comfortable. same as other Intercontinental brand hotels. But I found a lot of hair in the comforter. Obviously it had not been changed after previous guest stayed. Therefore, I left a message to change all lines to the room service. Then they changed next morning. 3. Location: Very good for travelers. Walking distance to SOHO, Village, TriBeCa. Lots of organic restaurant and supermarket. and of course Chinese and Italian restaurant. 4. Facility and equipment: No wireless internet access while I was staying. They tend to be out of order. you better be careful if you stay on business. 32" LCD screen TV was nice. It would be much better safe box was installed in the room. 3. Hospitality. Doorman was very helpful and arranged a car for me very politely and quickly. 4. Money Very cheap. 155USD for new year season is unbeatable. Over all, I recommend this hotel for single traveler who wanna save money but dont wanna sacrifice the location. I was a little worried to stay at this hotel after I read some of the negative comments. However, the hotel was pretty nice for short term. I would probably come back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: Although it was a one-night stay, I was completely satisfied with the room and service at this hotel. Did not eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. The room itself was spacious by NYC standards (including bathroom) and very clean. Linens were fresh, king size bed, extra pillows, large flat screen and a coffee maker. What more could you want from your room? Although the neighborhood around it might seem intimidating to those not familiar with NYC, it is really a convenient location (basically steps from Chinatown) and subway stop (Canal Street) is a block or so away. The only consideration that may negatively impact some visitors is that most of the restaurants in the immediate area around the hotel are Chinese, so if you don't care for that cuisine you might have to venture further to find a restaurant. There is a McD's and Burger King right around the corner, however. Front desk at hotel gave us a good recommendation for a Chinese restaurant which everyone in my group enjoyed. Would definitely stay here again, if I could get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: madagou
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and it was good! the rooms are comfy, free-wifi, good breakfast, employees helpful, not really far from Brooklyn bridge, close to China Town!! Next to the subway

Reviews.Title: “Oh that smell”
Reviews.Author: evahgn
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms booked for me and my boss. We did not stay, rooms where dirty ( hairs on bed) and smelled so awful. Air conditioner box at one side of bed left no room to walk, extremely small rooms. Manager did not even try to accommodate, we ended up paying a one night penalty and stayed somewhere else. Very nice bellman did call us a taxi and helped us to check out with tons of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cmh621
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing find... it's hard to come by inexpensive, spacious, comfortable hotels in NYC. You can't beat the location, right smack in the middle of Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. Right off the Williamsburg bridge. From other reviews, I thought the rooms were going to be tiny, but not at all! We had plenty of room and a great view! What really got my attention was the service. Everyone was so nice and accommodating, from valet (it's $55 but so worth the trouble of looking for a spot in the city) to the front desk (Cris was great!) to housekeeping, who were always so friendly when we passed by. Management even stopped by (Austin, I think his name was) to make sure everything was to our liking! Such a nice touch! I would go back in a second and I'm glad I have this little gem in my back pocket for when I stay in the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great find”
Reviews.Author: yipyap1470
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff - Stephanie? and Stephen?...they worked the night of Saturday, January 15, 2011. Super friendly and funny and helpful. Room was big! and clean and really the spot is convenient. I am most definitely going to stay here again..it was a bargain and the breakfast was more than adequate. A real find!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - I Am a Repeat Customer and Love it Each Time!”
Reviews.Author: Vinny067
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this fine hotel twice so far, first in September 2010 for 8 days and then in December 2010 -- this time with a friend -- for 9 days, and I have loved it each time. I am about to book another trip to theSoHo/Chinatown area for March 2011, and once again, after reviewing the other hotels available in the area (a number of which are a few dollars cheaper per night), I consciously and deliberately chose this hotel. I have found the staff, including concierges, doormen, front desk personnel, managers and housekeepng staff, to be happy, relaxed and very friendly and helpful. If I could change anything at all, I would like to see slightly larger rooms, but, given that this hotel is located in Manhattan, somewhat small rooms are par for the course, and I am not complaining at all about the room size. While some folks have complained about street noise from Lafayette St., I have never found it bothersome. One other great thing about this hotel is the location -- mere steps from Chinatown, Canal Street, Grand Street, Little Italy, SoHo, Tribeca and LES, and just a half-block from a great classic diner, The Landmark Diner, where I ate breakfast almost every day (except for Saturday mornings, when I tend to head over to Joey's Aquadolcia (insanely wonderful Italian deli/restaurant) on Grand St. Overall, I feel that this is a great hotel, and I love to come back to it again on each of my trips to Manhattan. P.S. I am not affiliated with the hotel in any way, they have no idea that I am leaving a review, and I have never received any compensation or renumeration for leaving this review. I simply offer it out of gratitude and appreciation. --Vinny

Reviews.Title: “A great four star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: There are some mixed reviews here but I had a great time. Good location - perfect for Chinatown, Little Italy etc. Easy subways. Cheap cabs to anywhere really. The rooms ARE small but it's NYC, most rooms are small. The breakfast was ok but head in to the city and have a local's breakfast. This is a four star hotel - if you want luxury or five stars, book a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, bad internet.”
Reviews.Author: Rdestaole
Reviews.Content: The hotel have a good location, near a three subway lines. you can go easily to differents points of the city. But the Hotel doesn´t is exactly in SoHo. is more near to Chinatow, near to Little Italy and to Soho. the only problem during our hosting was the internet (wi-fi free) offered by hotel that stayed off good part of the time. The bedroom is very small and the luggages need to share space with the people all time.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at this place is POOR.”
Reviews.Author: LaineyB4
Reviews.Content: No Wifi for our entire stay, were from out of the country and had no way to research where to go or what to do - we called Holiday Inn Corporate and found out that the hotel lied to us and said they were working on the problem when they didn't have a tech coming out until the Monday. We arrived on Wesnesday and they didn't have someone coming out for days.... Liars!! They never showed up to clean our room, dirty dishes and food and dirty linens in the hallway. Poor customer service. If your planning to spend this much to stay in New York, don't stay here. Unhelpful, dirty, are not what they advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for First time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jmbuga
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at this Hotel. The rooms were very large and clean. Would have preferred a safe in the room but was able to put valuables in a safe deposit box at the front desk. The age of the hotel shows a little sign of some wear but everything was clean and well kept. The area is really Chinatown not SOHO but it was still a great location. We had a wonderful dinner in little Italy a couple of blocks away. Parking is pricey at 50.00 a night but we found a garage a block over for 38. We would definitely stay their again. Booked on Hotwire for $80 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Location Made For Best and Worst Parts Of Trip”
Reviews.Author: travelgalcalgary
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good value @ $210/night - stayed 6 nights. Best - Desk Clerk recommended, within walking, Little Italy Mulberry Street restaurant for dinner - entire street decorated for the holiday season ++++++++++ Worst - Spent too much time on subway as taxi fare would be very pricey from midtown back to Soho. For me, a midtown location is better for Broadway shows, Central Park and department stores. I would however, recommend to friends who would appreciate this location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: HumphAust
Reviews.Content: As it was our first time to NYC we figured that we wanted to be in a hotel taht was central and walking distance to everywhere! This place certinly fits the bill. We wlkaed our feet off day and night and it was great to get back and relax in our room at the end of every day. We had a corner room - so I think it gave us a little more space than a standard room. Although the air con was the "out the window" type it was extrement effective and we needed it as it was a hot summer in NY. We didn't have time to eat in or search for any of the hotel facilites, as we wer eout exploring. But hte concierge and porters were knowlegable and helpful with local tips for eating, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn New York SoHo”
Reviews.Author: tommynine9
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was OK, with a few trip-ups. Cleanliness: 4/5, nothing majorly bad. A few marks here and there, but nothing terrible. Location: 4/5, Chinatown, really. Although it's not really SoHo, it's close to the subway and Little Italy. Rooms: 3.5/5, quite dated and small. The smallest hotel room I've had in New York. View from 13th floor okay. Beds were comfortable. No closet, wouldn't recommend for families of 4. Service: 3/5, although all the people we encountered were friendly, there were a couple check-in issues. First, the line was very, very long and we attempted to go to what was the Priority Club Platinum check-in, or at least the plaque was there. The other guests were rude and practically shoved us back with nothing from the staff. When we got our room, we went to it and someone else was occupying it. That was very major, so we went down and said to heck with it, went to the front of the line, and got a new room. And they give PC Plats a free drink coupon for the bar and they let us get two sodas instead of one alcoholic, which was nice. Value: N/A, used points. Sleep Quality: 4/5, fairly good. A little street noise, but comfortable beds. Overall: 18.5/25 = About 3.7 average.

Reviews.Title: “I hate to post this - but, pls beware of bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: cc_boston_88
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. Cannot say anything negative about the hotel. However - I feel compelled to share that shortly after I returned home, I had bedbugs in my apartment. I have contacted Holiday Inn Priority Club mgmnt to let them know. I recommend thoroughly searching your room for bugs if you stay here. Bugs can be caught anywhere. I cannot 100% state that the bugs were picked up in this hotel. But I feel as though it is the most obvious place for me to have encountered them. I stayed here and 1 other Holiday Inn hotel (Long Island City) during Sept./Oct. No other trips. Therefore, I probably picked up bugs here or @ Long Island City. Both hotels NEED to conduct a bedbug inspection and then post the results of their findings on TripAdvisor. Having bedbugs in your home is been mentally, physically, and monetarily exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go again”
Reviews.Author: lamington_jones
Reviews.Content: Booked the Holiday Inn Soho through Hotwire which got us a reasonable rate for Manhattan. The room was tight, but everyone says that's to be expected in a city like New York. Anyway, it didn't bother me at all. The room was clean and comfortable. What did bother me was noise from next door a couple of nights. We heard things from that room that no one should ever have to hear. This was our first trip to NYC so I really didn't know if the location would be good or disatrous. Reviews were mixed. Looking back I think the location was excellent. There was heaps of good shopping nearby. Great eating in Chinatown and Little Italy. Subway right there. And it was walking distance to the village area which of course we loved. Catching the subway or even a taxi uptown was easy and while we enjoyed Central Park and the Rockefeller, etc. we didn't feel we needed to be staying any closer to them. Nope, the Holiday Inn Soho (even if it's Chinatown) was just right for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Services”
Reviews.Author: MeMathias
Reviews.Content: Like all hotels in Manhattan, Holiday Inn is also expensive, not so expensive than others. The service is very fair, they have a good breakfast and it is well located in SoHo Downtown, near to subway lines 6 (Spring St. stop) and subway lines J, M, N, Q, R, W and Z (Canal St. stop). The staff is friendly and I could feel very welcome in this place. The room is well clear, comfortable, in a good size and follow some accessibility rules, the bathroom is small comparing to other hotels of same level. I have only one complain, the corridor (not the room) of my floor (13) smell mold, and should be a problem for whose have breathing issues, like asthma or bronchitis. It is in my list to stay next time in New York, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Location!”
Reviews.Author: WillmKr
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay in this hotel. The location is in one word unique. When you step outside, you'll have Chinatownt on your right hand, and Little Italy on your left hand. A subway station is just around the corner, and there are tons and tons of great restaurants in the neighbourhood. The hotel is clean and the staff is very kind. There is also a desk where you can order tickets for musicals, tours, that kinda stuff. You can have breakfast in the hotel, but for dinner you can better go outside and find a nice restaurant, because they only serve a few salads at the hotel. But that's certainly not a problem. The room is very clean and there is also a great WiFi connection. The room is not pretty big, we had 2 double beds, and the beds were pretty small for 2 people. Other reviews are saying that it's pretty crowdy, and that it's disturbing. But I wasn't disturbed at all! Yes, there is a subway station pretty close to the hotel but I didn't hear any noises.
