Enfin, I had a wonderful stay and next time I'm certainly gonna stay in this hotel again. I would recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, helpful staff in a shopping area.”
Reviews.Author: leinie61
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Clean, no bedbugs, helpful concierge and bellhops. good location if shopping from Houston to Worth, Broadway to Lafayette. Walk to Chinatown. Subways close. Room could have better shading for the mornings, but otherwise, recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddySnow
Reviews.Content: We got an incredible price for our two night stay at this hotel that it actually cost us more for parking than it did for the room. We were out most of the time and we only came back to the room to sleep. The room is cozy and quiet and very clean. We were a little concerned about bedbugs but none were reported. The hotel is a little far from all the action (Ground Zero, Times Square, etc.) but that could be a good thing. If I had to pay full price for the room, I would probably give the Value score a 2 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great mattress, quiet room, excellent location, what a deal!”
Reviews.Author: cincodeperro
Reviews.Content: Made reservation through hotel's website two months in advance and checked rates right before going, just to be informed, and the rates had doubled. Good to know. Did not like our room but got a much better one very fast from the front desk. Second room was on the twelfth floor, facing west with a pretty view. Lobby on second floor seems odd but quickly became very comfortable because of the peacefulness and the light from the many windows. Location cannot be beat. Most of the subway lines within quick walking distance. Left housekeeping a tip each day of the ten days there, it's a good plan. Hotel made our vacation easy and fun, we could start our explorations from there without any problems. Would go back in a New York minute!

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced”
Reviews.Author: JeterFan_10
Reviews.Content: The rates are way overpriced. Equivalent to New York 4 star hotels. The cable has maybe 20 channels, rooms are old and small. Location is just the southern end of Chinatown. It is close to the subways, so you can go visit places you would rather stay. The in-room air conditioners sound like your sleeping in a wind tunnel. Wireless internet is spotty at best. Could get work done at night in the room.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Rooms the Size of Microwave Ovens...”
Reviews.Author: DanishAccent
Reviews.Content: As everybody knows, you don't get much for your money when you stay at hotels in Manhattan, and Holiday Inn SoHo is living proof of that. My room was the size of a microwave oven; the breakfast buffet was unbelievably mediocre, but I still had to pay over $350 for my room. However, the people at the reception were great. A woman went out of her way to get me a good room with a view, so I didn't feel I was locked up in a prison somewhere. Will I recommend this hotel? Sure. After all, SoHo is one of the best parts of town, and if you're NOT silly enough to visit when the UN is in session or some Saint is being celebrated in Little Italy, you can probably get a deal that makes sense. Probably

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION OK - BUT NOT THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: PeteAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We cam eon holiday to New York thinking the location was of prime importance - so we decided on the Holiday Inn, in Soho. Belive me location is not so important - the transport system is great and taxi's plentiful -and we wish we had never decided on the Holiday Inn. The room was very poor, dirty walls and the carpets discusting - could use a clean after several years - the room small as it was smelt like a toilet - DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service. Great shower. Good price.”
Reviews.Author: Finch23
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from the Holiday Inn but was very pleasantly surprised. Very friendly service from all staff. Excellent location in the heart of downtown. Nice clean, simple room with a great shower and fantastic view. Comfy bed. Good wifi. All for $180. Pretty good deal i reckon. Only complaint was lack of safe in room. Otherwise highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good Service at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jensters
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this hotel and we were once again pleased with the service, cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff. The hotel offers good accommodation in an excellent location within New York City [Soho]. This is a lively area of the city and the hotel is well positioned for the subway and also in walking distance of a variety of attractions. It was more expensive on this occasion but that may have been due to the US holiday. In terms of the other New York hotels, this offers good accommodation but at a more affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: etacar11
Reviews.Content: Getting to this hotel from the A/C subway stop entails a long walk on Canal Street. Not fun, with the crowded sidewalk and the people hawking their cheap and tacky wares. One of my least favorite streets in the City. But once you get to the hotel itself, one block up Lafayette from Canal and one block from the 6 train stop, it's fine. The staff was polite and accommodating. The room was small, but that's pretty normal for NYC. Everything was clean and comfortable, and despite being small, definitely not cramped. No free breakfast but the on-site restaurant had good food. There's also a Dunkin Donuts across the street. We were on the 3rd floor and could hear the subway constantly going by underground. Once we fell asleep, it was no bother, though. So, all in all, not a bad hotel, though I'm not crazy about its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: jattwooll
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of the Hotel before and felt I should give back. The hotel was perfect and for under $200/per night in a City like this I was pleasantly surprised. Beds were nice rooms were good enough not huge but what room is in NYC. Front desk was nice. They asked what brought us down and I mentioned a wedding anniversary which was a surprise. Right after we got into our rooms there was a knock on the door and a bottle of nice red wine was delivered on the house. I was impressed all around. Jeff-Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Mother/Daughter trip -- good value but spotty service”
Reviews.Author: MAtraveler123
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself if a good value -- especially if you can get a promo rate (which we did). The hotel is at the corner of Canal and Lafayette which is very convenient to the subway but is a misery when trying to navigate through the area because of the constant "rolex, coach, vuitton bags" hawkers, side walk peddlers and hordes of people looking for knock off bargains. Many good neighborhood restaurants within easy walking distance where you get to talk with owners and friendly staff as well as partake of good food. Close to shopping and attractions. Easy walk to the Brooklyn Bridge and Century 21. The room was clean and about average size for a Manhattan hotel (read small). The bathroom is VERY small -- difficult to close the door while in the bathroom. At one point it was easier to get into the tub to close the door. On the upside, the towels were plentiful and the bathroom was clean. Also, the housekeeping staff wrote very sweet thank you notes each day for the tips I left. This is a first! The hotel itself was very quiet -- not a lot of guest noise. But you can feel and hear the subway running. We were on the 7th floor and we heard it like clockwork every 3-5 minutes. Service was spotty. We walked in at 11 pm to check in and the bell hop just looked at us and point to the escalator to the second floor so we could check in. No offer to help with the bags, no pointing out the elevators. Lost money in the vending machine getting a water -- Heard the water drop but it didn't fall into the delivery chute. Called the front desk to ask for help. She said someone would be up in 5 minutes. 25 minutes later I called front desk again and she said they'd be right up and would bring the water to my room so I wouldn't have to stand at the vending machine. I'm still waiting. One evening we needed a taxi to get Uptown for a dinner reservation. One bell man took us out to Lafayette but nothing. Next a man, who appeared to be his manager, came out and took us to the next cross street explaining it's easier to get a taxi on that street. And it was. He escorted us and made sure we got into the taxi. Very helpful, good service. On our last day, we had to check out well before our train left so I asked a bell man to hold our bags and arrange for a taxi for 3:30 to take us to Penn Station. When we got there the bags were brought out but I was told by the bell man that rather than get me a taxi, he had a town car. Turns out it was a friend of his. So my $11 cab ride to Penn Station turned into a $20 town car ride and he didn't even drop us near the entry to Penn Station. All in all, if you go in with low expectations, you will find this to be a good hotel. The value is there and the closeness to shopping, good restaurants and attractions make it worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “the worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: MariMichelena
Reviews.Content: it started bad when they (Mathew) wouldnt allow my husband and daugther to check in because the reservation was under my name and I wasnt there (they had the printout of my reservation, my suitcases, all the passports, and my daughter has my same name) (In peru women dont change the names when getting married). My husband waited for two hours (I was waiting for somebody at penn station and the train was late, I couldnt leave). After more than two hours sitting in the lobby, instead of giving a solution, they told him to LEAVE, said he couldnt stay there, they just DIDNT BELIEVE HIM. I arrived at that moment and we checked in. The room was small, (ok, this is manhattan), but really noisy, because we had the roof and all the air conditioning devices of the nex door building just outside our window (also the subway that seemd an earthquake every few minutes, again this is manhattan). ok, when we were finally leaving, we checked under the beds for anything we could be forgetting, and we found a piece of DIRTY UNDERWEAR (NOT OURS), that was the cherry on the cake. we had been there three nights and the cleaning service hadnt reached an inch under the bed since the previous guest, at least.

Reviews.Title: “A value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman53
Reviews.Content: For our son's wedding we had to accommodate our extended family of 9 in NYC. This property was great value in a great location. Staff very friendly and happy to help us with any of the needs that foreigners in a new city require. The rooms are small but adequate. The beds were very comfortable. No bar fridge but we were out most days. Not the first choice for my wife and I but if you have family, and you're picking up the tab, great value. Martha, Desiree, Matthew and Michael are a well trained and disciplined crew. Thanks for all your help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pinkrose78
Reviews.Content: Great location not so friendly staff. Great deals in the area t shop & little Italy just right around the corner. Rooms need updating.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced hotel in Soho”
Reviews.Author: Tressa90
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location. Close to China town and Soho, great restaurants and shopping. The rooms are tiny , a little worn but but very clean. The valet staff are a great bunch, super helpful when it came to parking and storing luggage. Concierge service was a bit lacking, I called for someone to fix my air conditioning unit but no one ever came. But this hotel is certainly the best value in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean hotel, but location is more like chinatown”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelaaa
Reviews.Content: location is more like chinatown than it is soho, but nice hotel, rooms, and staff. if you get upgraded the suites are very spacious and nice, but you have to be a body builder to open and close the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our plans”
Reviews.Author: domluv87
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on tripadvisor and decided to give this hotel a try. I second what has been said before; clean but small rooms, very friendly staff, great location near Little Italy, Chinatown, and the subway. We had a king size bed that was heaven after pounding the Manhattan pavement all day. We did not have noise issues but we were on the 11th floor. We got an exceptionally good rate on hotwire which made this hotel a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay @ the HIEx Soho”
Reviews.Author: Steve_B10
Reviews.Content: My recent stay was nice. This room was small but quite adequate with a king bed and large screen TV. The closet space was sufficient as was the bathroom. The air conditioning functioned very well to my relief, since it was very hot during my stay. Also, I found the hotel quiet with no noise problems (athough others had mentioned adverse conditions). The staff was very helpful and the best feature was the location, including many shops within easy walking distance. The subway is one block away although I took taxi's most of the time. Excellent adventures in Little Italy and Chinatown! At well under $300 per night, this is an excellent option in Soho and offers great value. I plan on staying here again next month.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but noisy and too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: nathcaes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok but we had to change room because the first room we were in was so noisy we hardly could sleep there. I found it too expensive but I am afraid it is the case for all New York hotels

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Looking
Reviews.Content: Because we paid $161 (Expedia) this hotel was fine. Our 7th room was small (2 double beds) but very clean & fine for a night. You hear the subway, but if you're tired, you sleep fine. The front desk is efficient, the bar tender (Mike) an excellent host & even the security (Raoul) was efficient at the job & congenial to guests. We ate breakfast in the hotel & it was delicious. However, BEWARE the charges! We were charged 18% "service charge" even though we were a party of 4. It's frustrating that this was not pointed out to us because we left an additional 20%, our normal tip on a meal. So, our server made out like a bandit with a 38% tip ~ negating our $161 good deal of a room price. Had this not happened, we would have been pleased with everything else. So, hope someone learns from us. We'll recommend vs. not because the other employees deserve credit for jobs honest & well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: crimson325
Reviews.Content: Having lived in NYC for 6 years and coming back for the first time without my own apartment in the City, I was a little worried about finding a hotel. I got a room at this hotel for a Saturday night for $100 on priceline, which seemed almost too good to be true. I figured that the location would be great, if nothing else. After reading the reviews here, I was reassured it would be fine. I did follow advice to ask for a room on a higher floor, but on the day of check-in, all they had was one of the 5th floor. We faced a side street (this may be the most important thing to ask for!) and had NO trouble with noise. I'm a light sleeper but with the big curtains pulled and the AC running, heard nothing. The room was small but perfectly comfortable and clean. The front desk people were helpful and friendly, which was especially impressive given some of the questions I heard them answering. Note - the bellmen are really pushy with offering to help you get a cab. They then call a car service which is probably more expensive and likely gives them kickbacks. I hate when I see things like this because I feel like people are just scamming clueless tourists. Don't fall for this! You're in a busy area of NYC - just walk out the door and turn right and go down a block to Canal street and you'll have no problem getting a legitimate yellow cab for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: KennyToronto
Reviews.Content: I found a great rate for this hotel online so decided to give it a try. I just wanted a basic hotel with clean, friendly service, basically a place to crash with no complaints after busy days of touring. I was very pleased with my stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was basic but just what we needed, nothing special, but nothing to worry about. I liked the location, it was easy to get anywhere in the city via the very nearby subway station. We requested a room higher up and they were more then happy to accommodate. Was exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Descriptions on booking site do not tally with actual rooms - unhelpful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Lucytravelot
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel and definitely the last. Chosen purely for the location we stayed 5 days in September last year, booking and paying well in advance. Our booking site print out described the room as 'Superior' and after realising it was definitely not superior we had to spend 2 nights there because there were no others available. Admittedly, they upgraded us to a Junior Suite on the 3rd night but tried to say the internet booking description was mistaken, i.e. no fault of theirs. This May, we booked one night there as the Best western Bowery Hanbee had no availability for that particular night so again we gave it a try, also having booked and paid for the room. We were given a small room with a small bed and only one bedside table with light (I realised this was actually a room for a disabled person). The room description on the booking sheet was " Standard Room with one KINGSIZE bed or TWO DOUBLES". We complained but again were told there were no others available. Oh, they stuck two tickets for a complimentary breakfast under the door. Needless to say, we did not take up their offer of breakfast (having tried it the previous time) and were not even offered a discount on the room. Conclusion: once they have your money you are just given any old room. The duty manager tried to say it was all the fault of the booking site (again) and nothing to do with the hotel. This is a dark, dingy, hotel, which is very overpriced and does not respect customers. Stay at the Best Western Bowery Hanbee - it is clean and bright and the staff are the most helpful you could wish for. Their breakfast is also very good and is complimentary, unlike the Holiday Inn Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tigerman93
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here. The rooms are not that big but the price was good for a nice hotel like this. The staff are great too. Located very close to Little Italy and Canal St. Great spot for shopping and food. We are planning a return trip and intend on staying here again. We find it the best value for the location and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: americagirl22
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline for a bargain and thought maybe for that money the hotel would not be so great. Well, we were wrong about that one: it was excellent! The hotel was very pleasant and the staff went out of their way to make our stay as good as possible. We had asked for a room on a high floor with a view but when we arrived there wasn't one available. However the manager immediately offered us a room on a high floor for the next day, the bellboy would move our suitcases during the day so that we didn't have to make any effort at all and when we came back at night we had a superb and really spacious King bed room on the 13th floor with a lovely view over Soho. The room on the 3rd floor was also okay though. It was less noisy because the traffic noise was blocked by the high buildings around us. Over all we thought the hotel was really quiet. We never heard our neighbours or the elevator or anything like that. And the beds were amazing!! I wanted to take my bed home since it was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in The neighbourhood is just awesome. Just a few blocks away from Soho's best streets: Spring st. and Prince st. The subway is around the corner. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Excellent Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMom48
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend shopping trip with my teenaged daughter. The room was very clean, though a bit small. (It's NYC, after all.) Pictures on their web site are accurate. Our room was so quiet that we assumed the hotel was empty, but we saw plenty of people in the lobby the next morning. Every single staff member we ran into was cheerful, polite and helpful, from the fabulous young ladies at the front desk to the very nice waitress for breakfast. The hotel is very well located -- at the edge of Chinatown and a block from great shopping on Broadway. All floors except one are nonsmoking, which was perfect. Only very minor issue was that the remote for the TV was a little quirky. But we weren't watching much TV so it wasn't a problem. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: LesAiles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in Manhattan. Nice restaurants in little Italy at 2 blocks. Be careful, the room could be noisy. My advise ask for a room at a upper level The service is quick and good.

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location and Friendliness can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: jbhb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week - 2 adults and a 6 year old. The hotel is not luxurious but it is clean and the staff is genuinely friendly. The rate we got on Priceline was less than $100 and that's simply unbeatable, plus there's free wireless. Location is perfect for those who like it downtown and it is close to both the 4,5,6 and A,C,E trains which make it super easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hard beds”
Reviews.Author: ngerecitano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my wife and me. We got an incredible rate that no one else could match. The location was perfect for catching any uptown trains since the Canal St. station is literally a block away. Little Italy and Chinatown are just a block away. The staff, especially the cleaning staff, are extremely friendly and will take care of anything you need. For a New York hotel room, the rooms were large. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, but noisy and no longer a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Tashatraveller
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and pleasant. Compact size but what you'd expect in Manhattan for the price. My biggest issue was noise from the subway and street - try and get on a higher floor if you stay here (I was on 4). Staff were helpful and professional, I really only interacted with them on check-in and check-out and both were fine. Location was OK, not great. After years of travelling to NY and staying midtown, I thought I would try Soho. I definitely missed the boat on that one - I didn't find any interesting art studios etc, just fast food stores and clothing outlets. Positives were that this hotel is very close to a subway (Canal St) and chinatown. If you're interested in midtown and uptown sights and shopping however, you'll be on the subway for a while each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelley4542
Reviews.Content: At first, I was skeptical of staying here due to the bad reviews posted on TripAdvisor. However, I was very pleased to find out how wonderful and clean this hotel really was. The hotel had been recently renovated and MAKE sure to bid for this hotel on priceline instead of paying current rates right at 200 plus. I won this hotel on Priceline for 72 dollars per night(betterbidding.com to check out pricing strategies). I was unbelievably pleased with what I got for the money. The hotel was a block from the subway and right in the middle of Chinatown and Little Italy. I gave this hotel 4 stars because I had a problem with the free wifi. No one at the front desk will help you fix the connection problem; they redirect you to a troubleshooting hotline that tries to help you finf a solution. Make a long story short, I was never able to fix my computer connection problem. P.S. do not pay the 65 dollars to park at the hotel if your driving. Park on the side of the streets in Bronxville, Scarsdale, etc...and take the train in. I was able to park on a bridge in Bronxville for free and only 4 blocks away from the train station!! Drive around and look at the parking signs; its very easy to find a parking space on the street for 4 or so days. You will not be disappointed with this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lalawgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late Feb with two friends. We scored an amazing deal on Hotwire for this hotel, and had no idea what to expect. We were very pleased with the property! The room was clean and cozy, but was plenty big for three of us (esp. considering the size of some NYC rooms). The room looked like it was recently renovated (flat screen, updated bed and linens). The staff at check in was very nice, and the doormen were always there to hail us a cab. The location was excellent, too, close to nearly every subway line, and walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy. There is a small fitness room on the bottom floor, but we did not use it. We did use the high speed internet (wireless, and best of all FREE)

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasBunny
Reviews.Content: The staff was clueless and rude regarding the property. Room was decent, not the best I have stayed in. Food could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and dishonest service. Will never ever go back.”
Reviews.Author: sweetxbunny
Reviews.Content: the staff was extremely rude and very clueless about everything i ask. The price is not what they say on the website and they also put extra fees and never explain why it was there. i do not recommend this place to anyone because everything about this place is horrible from staff to the dishonesty of their service. what they say on the website is completely different when you're actually there. its also not worth over 200 a night there. i will never ever return to this place ever again.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Dump”
Reviews.Author: RockDoc50
Reviews.Content: What a dump of a hotel. This was probably my worst stay in over 10 years at any hotel. It started with check-in. The lobby is on the 2nd floor, but the escalators at the hotel entrance were out of service. One of the elevators was also out of service, making it very inconvenient because of long waits. I have Intercontinental Platinum Ambassador status and used some of my Priority points for this stay. Obviously a big mistake. I understand that “family hotels” have discretion about offering extra amenities for those who hold Intercontinental elite status. That being said, I didn’t even get the type of room that I reserved (twin beds in a disability room). I got a regular room the size of a large walk-in closet with two twin beds . No room upgrade of any type offered. The only amenities offered were free local calls (which I don’t need) and a free soft drink (just one, not two to accommodate my colleague with whom I shared the room). The room was on a low floor (6th) with absolutely no view—sides of other buildings and heating/air conditioner systems from the buildings below. Just delightful. The room was filthy and stunk. Impossible to regulate the heat with an antiquated heating system. Had to open the windows with freezing temperatures in order to cool the room down. Thin, barely adequate bed blankets. My dorm room in college 40 years ago was much nicer. When my colleague complained about the room we were told there was nothing to be done about it. The front desk staff was clueless about driving directions and parking options. The phone in our room didn’t work properly. We decided it was useless to complain or to ask for any type of service at the hotel. So we gave up and had a miserably uncomfortable stay. Thankfully it was for only one night. . I couldn’t wait to check out and leave. I felt that I needed to take a shower when I finally arrived home. This is how Priority Club treats its best and most loyal elite members. Needless to say I will never stay at this hotel again, great location notwithstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn SoHo-Good!”
Reviews.Author: smilesryan
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this centrally located hotel, just off China town but near enough to all the best things in New York. We stayed for two weeks and had a great time. Staff were friendly, helpful...I'd go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel, killer location, good price”
Reviews.Author: EarlysvilleTraveller
Reviews.Content: Sound isolation: excellent. Never heard our neighbors, and I know for sure that there were loud French people with children on either side. Room: adequate, but gets a special rating-boost, in my opinion, for having a window that opens. Maybe this isn't important to you, but I really like it. Staff: friendly, efficient. Food and beverage: nothing to speak of. But for Fiorello's sake, you're in the middle of Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho. Why should the hotel try to compete with the fascinating, abundant nightlife within a few hundred meters of the hotel? Try the Red Egg (50m east) for Chinese, or the Deluxe Bagel (150m south) for breakfast. Location: REALLY interesting. The shopping is amazing: you can get a Rolex Oyster watch, normally $15,000, for fifty bucks! Business functions: the Wireless internet in the room wasn't quite in range. But it works in the lobby. The lobby also contains computers with printers that are free to use to print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Chinatown hotel to explre NYC”
Reviews.Author: Peter51964
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in this hotel in early December. Its within 2 minutes of a subway (line 6) Clean comfortable friendly staff. Great location to explore NYC and easy to get away from. Dont expect a lively bar scene as most times staff outnumbered guests. Bar ran out of beer twice!!! not as a result of lively place just incompetant stock levels. Loads of cheap good eating places local and only 20 mins from Grand Central Station. I would use this hotel as a base to explore but not spend a lot of time there. Hotel breakfast $50 for two - dont go there- go out and find a local deli or diner half the price and much better. Staff are very helpfull. Overall a good base for exploring NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch at Its Best”
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel were fine, but there is no hot food available on site. The dinner menu is only sandwiches. Breakfast is reheated from another location. The bar has virtually nothing to offer. When I tried to eat in the bar, the bar had no wine (any varietal), no gin, no vodka. One patron ordered a margarita and the bar didn't have any margartia mix. I ordered a sandwich (since that was my only choice for dinner in the hotel) and paid $ 15 for a ham sandwich. The hotel is certainly not luxury, but they charge prices much like a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky!!”
Reviews.Author: ccerio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Soho, we love Soho and needed something inexpensive so this place worked well. We had some issues checking in where the front desk had trouble finding our reservation. After a long day of apartment searching I was probably not as friendly as I could be with their blank stares as they tried to figure out what had happened to our reservation. But they did get everything straightened out, however I don’t think I was their favorite customer b/c they put us in room directly next to the elevator on the 3rd floor. When we walked into our room I nearly fell back with the smell of mildew. My husband told me I was being dramatic and to be fair I have a really good sense of smell, but any mildew smell is not welcome when you are paying $200 a night. The source of the odor was the bathroom which seemed to be covered in mildew. So we kept the door closed as much as possible. I should have asked to change rooms, but we were in a rush. The bed was too soft in that creepy overused way, and our view was a air-conditioning unit. All and I would say if you can stay someplace else do… be sure to check your room and ask for a change if it smells.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, highly reccommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: podge72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice altogether on two seperate trips to New York, i would reccommend this hotel to anyone!! Rooms are clean, nice size, all staff are fabulous with great manners and cant do enough. If you want ideal location, good price, clean and not stuffy then this hotel is ideal!! However if you want the once-in-a-lifetime trip to New York then i doubt this hotel will be for you, because your expectations will far out weigh what this hotel actually offers. You cannot expect 5* plus at this gem but by god its smack dab where i think sums up New York at its best Downtown where everything is not over priced for the tourist unlike Midtown etc. I have NEVER EVER felt afraid in the areas around this hotel and being a hated smoker i even stood outside taking a phone call at 3am having a smoke and didnt feel at all frightend. I love this area and would and have encouraged friends to come here when they have travelled to New York!!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST! in NYC”
Reviews.Author: canessa513
Reviews.Content: Cris was the best front desk person I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Always greeted the guest by name. She knew the answer to ever question I had about the area. Premium customer service by the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: RM1Paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located within Manhattan. Within walking distance of Little Italy, Chinatown, the subway and of course, Soho. Service is good and you get excellent value at this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean rooms, good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: maldoliza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right up the street from Canal Street and all the great shopping in Chinatown and Little Italy. It's a mid-grade hotel, nothing really outstanding about it, but clean, decent. Train station is a few blocks away. The rooms are comfortable, actually nice size for the area. I would stay here again if I wanted to be downtown and was looking for a really reasonable rate. Got it for just a bit over $100, which is never bad for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, Quiet (for NYC) - a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andyocity
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a wedding and got a fantastic rate. Room was spacious, free internet, nice meeting area on 2nd floor. In a great location for fun and walking (on Canal and Lafayette) near chinatown and some tourist shopping). This isn't a fancy area, but a fun one for sure. I will definitely try to stay here again next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: heyBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the weekend with a few girlfriends and it was definitely a great place to stay. We were in a very convenient location directly in the city - close to plenty of restaurants, shopping, bars, etc. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and tips about the big city. The rooms were comfortable and clean. I look forward to staying here during my next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: realcorkboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel isnt as bad as some people make out. At least not for me. The lobby is grubby and gives a traveler a feeling of apprehension for sure but the rooms are clean,well maintained and all the furnishings are now. Some little extras too like coffee making facilities are nice. Iron and board, lots of channels, full length mirrors, secure doors and generally good value. As far as Manhattan goes for room prices this place is a steal for the price conscious traveler but if you have more money and want something less basic then don't stay here, But I don't think people see Holiday Inn as anything more than budget.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL TO STAY THOUGH WISH THE MGT MORE FLEXIBLE W/ Lugguage Policy”
Reviews.Author: starofjupiter
Reviews.Content: Stay 1 night on Sept 3, 2009 using the Priority Club Points as we had to join a tour in the nearby Chinatown the next day and the location of this hotel from the pick up point is about 4 blocks away. Everyone is VERY NICE upon check in as my 3 yrs old daughter was crying out loud her heart to learn that we didn't stay in Sheraton LaGuardia as we did the previous 2 nights but here, I was really embarrassed but the check in staff was fanstastic, came out and tried to calm her down but futile. Beat me sometimes todlers are so "sensitive " & "passionate" about the hotel that they once stayed. The only complaint that I have is that the hotel will not hold our luggage for 2 nights if we don't have a future reservation and quoted us due to liability and suggested that we stored our lugguage in Penn Station. This is a crazy suggestion as we arrived in the late evening that night and will have no time to travel to Penn Station that night as we only need to store 1 piece so that the next morning we didn't need to drag 2 pieces of luggage when we joined our 3 days 2 nights tour to Philly, Washington DC/Niagara Falls and Thousand Island. We explained that we are going to book their car service upon our return on 3rd day to Jersey City and would this change? No, SORRY, that is the reply! I found this VERY DISCRIMATING as a guest as it sounds like they will hold luggage for you if you have a future stay, otherwise, once your stay is over, SORRY, you are not my guest anymore and that is your problem! In my prior stay of hotel like Sheraton Vancouver, they willing to hold and charge you a nominal fee per night of holding . This is at least an option and being helpful to your guest and not give us a rediculous suggestion that we store at Penn Station. So, apart from this issue of not able to hold our 1 piece luggage since we have no pending reservation, which I found unappreciated as a guest as well as being an UNHELPFUL hotel meeting guest needs. Overall, room is clean and comfortable as they put us on club floor and indeed, no street noise or subway train vibrations. Staff are friendly & helpful apart from the incident that not able to hold our 1 piece luggage for 2 nights even though we booked with them the car service upon our return. I would still recommend this hotel stay to friend and family though would advise them to take into consideration the no luggage hold if there is no future reservation with them.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: alvaropb
Reviews.Content: My first time in NYC and thought Soho was a nice neighborhood. But this hotel is in Soho, but I can say it was the beggining of Chinatown. During the night the street is empty until you reach Canal St. and did not look very safe to me. I was given a room facing Lafayette, and when the metro passed by the room vibrated and the noise was unpleasent. Fortunately my friends were given a room facing the opposite side and they did not experience this. The room was clean, the room had a reasonable size for the price paid, but there were things lacking like a modern TV (because it seemed very old) a better preserved air-conditioning (old and temperature varied within heat and cold). The bed and bath had a good size. I recommed it just if you can't afford a pricier one.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: ske14695
Reviews.Content: Do not know where to start...this hotel single handedly ruined my holiday in NYC. It was the first time a hotel room has made me cry! The room was small - no make that tiny, smelly, dirty and looked NOTHING like the photos on the website - do not get sucked in about their claim of spacious rooms that were renovated in 2003. I cannot believe they charged what they did for the room (over $300US / night) - to think of the hotels i could have stayed in!!! It is NOT in the middle of Soho...it is on the very edge of Soho across the road from Chinatown. It is not a glamourous part of NYC - and travelling solo I did not feel safe in the area. I still cannot believe I was stupid enough to stay there...shame on you Holiday Inn - you may not be the most glamourous hotel chain in the world but there is still a level of expectation that you did not meet at this hotel. I doubt I will ever stay at a Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Sufferer
Reviews.Content: Travelling to New York for the very first time with family, I selected this hotel from the net because of its price and 'perceived' location, and most of all the name 'Holiday Inn'. Little did I know what I was getting into. The issue was much greater than small / dirty rooms or noisy airconditioner and vibrating floors due to underground trains. Upon arrival the hotel's Bell Service saw us being dropped off by an expensive car service and promptly mentioned to us that they have a cheaper service available @ $49, which could drop us off to JFK airport, when we'll check-out. We said okay. After about three days when we checked out, the hotel arranged its 'economical' taxi service. The driver of the car started off with the flat tire (which we realized after 2 minutes). He ignored the people on the street waving and pointing this to him. He did not pull over the car when we asked him to do so, until such time that the smoke from the tire started to come out. Then he kept driving insisting to get the tire changed from some specific shop. When the car finally stopped at the tire workshop.......some Spanish guys came and asked my whole family to come out of the car so that they can change the tire. In trying to take out the spare tire from the car our luggage was put on the road. Then one guy tricked me into the tire shop and took hold of my brief case and ran off. Incidentally, the brief case had our passports, visas, cash and valuables. Later, we realized that another car had been following us all along, that car was found parked at the tire shop and was most probably used by the gangsters to run away. By the time police came they had already fled. As family with small children, we were emotionally shaken. The bottom line is ...It was a 'set up', in which the involvement of hotel staff can not be ruled out. We had opted for the hotel's airport drop off service as it was considered to safer being offered by 'Holiday Inn'. Due to this incident, the whole trip is now a great tragedy.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LabmomMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the 4th of July weekend. The room was small with a king size bed but we still had enough room to move around comfortably. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and we could not hear any of the noise from the street below or from the hallway even though we were right across from the elevator. The staff was helpful any time we had a question. We were given a map when we checked in and believe me when I say that map was used.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Will I Stay Here Again Even if It's Free”
Reviews.Author: VacationSeaker
Reviews.Content: This was my worst hotel experience. Believe me. I mean that. I have travelled all over the world staying in all types of hotel but this was the dirtiest hotel I have ever been in. It was so full of dust and mold that the first nite I stayed, my allergies acted up so bad that I did not sleep all night but dealing with running nose, sneezes and headaches. The supposed to be "white" curtains are grey. I moved the bed a little towards the wall so my little girl would not fall off the bed and there was sooooo much dust and dirt underneath the bed that it was absolutely disgusting. I left it that way in the morning and housekeeping still did not cleaned it up or vaccum the "now exposed" area under the bed. I would not stay here ever again even if it's free. When I complained to the front desk, they were accommodating, tried to switch me to different rooms but each room that they show me, it was the same - moldy, dusty, and dirty. It was over $200 a night. I took my parents there, we had 2 separate rooms and even my parents who came from overseas to visit said they have never been in a hotel this bad of a shape!!! Don't make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “good location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbothra
Reviews.Content: very average hotel... but if u want to stay downtown for cheap it is an option

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mia6464
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn while I was on a business trip. The hotel is right between Chinatown, Soho, and Little Italy. At night, there was tons to do, all within a few blocks. I had dinner most nights in Littly Italy. YUM! Broadway is about a block away from the hotel and there's tons of great shopping there (considered Soho, maybe?). My room was pretty nice, bigger than I expected actually. The bed was really comfortable too! My room was on the 14th floor and I had a great view of the Empire State Building! I saw a lot of the same staff members there the whole week - like front desk clerks and bellmen. They were always super nice and helpful. I'd read another review about some internet problems, so I was a little worried as I do a lot of work in the evenings. My wireless connection worked fine the whole time - speed was good and never got kicked off. One of the girls at the front desk told me they'd recently upgraded their system. Either way, it worked fine for me. Definitely a good hotel for business or a vacation in New York. I'd love to spend a weekend and wander around the area more! There was so much to see and do nearby! Oh - and there's a subway stop less than a block away from the hotel. It's really easy and quick to get to Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: lola123
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal on a room, 114$ on hotwire, so this was the perfect hotel ! Close to soho, chinatown, little italy, etc...staff was very friendly, room was very clean, altough a little worn. we stayed with our 2 year old and 7 month old, they had very little room to play in , but it was still manageable. the only reason i did not give 5 stars is because of troubles with the vending machines, there are 4 on different floors, the first three we tried were either broken or sold only water... i have reccomend this hotel to family,and they will try it soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Koolit
Reviews.Content: Just a half block norh of Chinatown is just right for me and my Son - we both love Chinese food. Great property in mist of everything great about Manhattan - Soho, Greenwich Village, Financial District and of course Chinatown. Rooms were excellent and the staff was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: labonvoyer
Reviews.Content: This is not the Plaza...but the price is right and the location is fabulous!! It is a very walkable neighborhood with fun shopping in Chinatown and eating in Little Italy. The subway is right down the block for access to the whole of Manhattan. The subway ride to 42th street Broadway shows is 5" away. It is a easy subway ride to Coney Island to check it out. It's close enough to walk to ground zero. The rooms are so-so...who cares? Have a great breakfast at Baltazar then go for a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge...then explore all the NYC sights..The staff was wonderful and extremely helpful. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Freya2007
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a short city break this Easter 2009. We found it excellent value in an exciting location. The hotel is clean and the rooms are made spotless each day the staff are friendly and helpful. The location is basically on the edge on Chinatown with Little Italy 5 minutes walk away. You are 2 minutes from Canal street subway which links you to the rest of New York (subway system excellent and cheap!). Dunkin Donuts is just across the road ideal for coffee and muffin for breakfast as hotel breakfast is overpriced but who wants to eat in the hotel. Location is walking distance to Wall Street and financial district (ground zero) if you don't want to use subway and you have a good selection of shops just up on Broadway again walkable. We are from Gloucestershire in the UK which is very rural and I found the area exciting but in no way intimidating. I think it’s a great location to explore the real New York not just the sanitised Time Square and Central Park areas. Although these are only 5 minutes away on the subway. Check out the Abercrombie and Fitch shop on 5th Avenue also I’ve never been in a shop like it! It’s just worth going to see the dancing shop assistants!

Reviews.Title: “price was good”
Reviews.Author: chasjr123
Reviews.Content: this hotel is over 15 years old as a holiday inn. The location was great but the room quality is not good. The rooms are very outdated and need to be updated. The staff was not very caring. They lied to people trying to convince them to join the reward program and was not telling the guest the truth about the program. I had a very nice room with a good view but has mildew in the shower and the walls were very outdated. Overall the hotel was a good place and for the price it was great being in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: uksunLV
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel with clean rooms and helpful staff. There was nothing exceptional but I wouldn't have expected it to be so considering the price and chain. My partner and I were very comfortable and happy with our choice for a long weekend, especially good if you want to be downtown, try midtown hotels if you really want to be in the thick of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, location, cleanliness, and value”
Reviews.Author: Bailey2004
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in downtown/Soho that is clean, quiet, convenient, basic amenities, this is it. I wanted to stay downtown and am very familiar with NY. I did not need any real amenities because this is NY and I can experience them elsewhere. Great location one block to Chinatown, Little Italy, NOHO, Broadway one block west. The room with two doubles was small but updated...two women for a girlie weekend sufficed. We had huge windows and the beds and bathroom were adequate. After having stayed at many larger hotels in the city...Westin, St. Regis, Millenium, Intercontinental, what I liked best about the hotel? The fact that you can walk in through the front door and be in your hotel room in less than five minutes. The larger hotels can be a maze. The least thing I liked? I was on the 9th floor and when the subway revs up you can hear a slight rumbling. If you are a heavy sleeper, do not worry. If you are a light sleeper, request a higher level floor...there are 14 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Friendly”
Reviews.Author: zooloo29
Reviews.Content: There isn't that much to see or do immediately outside the door, but the hotel is still in a fairly good location - near SoHo, Chinatown and Little Italy. Also, the "Canal Street" subway stop is only a block or two away. That was very convenient for us. It's less than a $10 cab ride to the East Village (20-minute walk) where there are TONS of good restaurants to choose from. My friend and I counted 15+ different ethnic cuisines just along a few blocks on 1st Avenue in the East Village. The room and bathroom were both clean. The beds were really comfortable. The staff probably could have been a little more helpful. I suppose that we were content just scoping out the city on our own though. The doorman/bellhop was great with our luggage and getting us a cab. Overall, I would say that you will get a little more than your money's worth here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Nice location”
Reviews.Author: theskiingjj
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. It was quite other than the heater, that made some noise when it was left on for too long. It is half a block from the subway!! It is also right between China town, Little Italy, and Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Efficient and Economical”
Reviews.Author: tmurph13
Reviews.Content: I travel on business to New York 3-4 times a year. I stay at this hotel most times. For business travellers its very good value and convenient to Downtown. A walk to Wal Street takes about 15 minutes. The location is actually more Chinatown than Soho and Little Italy is two blocks away. Rooms can be small, so couples or groups sharing could find this very tight quarters (welcome to Manhattan!!). I am a Priority Club member and find the upgrades to a bigger room when available can be very helpful. I've stayed at this hotel at least 10 times over thelast 5 years and the staff are consistently attentive and helpful. The doormen/bellhops, for instance, are terrific. The car service they can arrange is quite good in tems of reliabilty and value. The rooms are always clean and the views from the higher floors are pretty good. The A/C Heating are old equipment, but have always done the job for me. As a location, its certainly fine for the business traveller and would be good for shoppers and younger travelers. The dining facilities are basic, though the food quality and price is good, so room service is fine. The internet acces is wireless and can be very ropey in terms of speed, so you won't be streaming video to your laptop, but you can get your email and browse the net.

Reviews.Title: “14th floor good, 10th floor bad,”
Reviews.Author: Dodsworg
Reviews.Content: Tale of 2 rooms. I stayed in 1420 and had a great view and (by Manhattan standards) had a huge room. Great bed - loved it. I also know NY a little and loved the location on the edge of Chinatown / Soho. Also used to staying in places where you get nothing :), so free access to NYSports Club a couple of blocks away much appreciated. My Mum (smoker) in 1013. Terrible room, dodgy decor, much smaller, allegedly double bed, AC with life of its own etcetc - guess that's what happens if you smoke nowadays :). Also, her first trip to NY and location a bit 'edgy' for her. So, I'd go back and would ask for the same room. Taking an elderly (65+) parent. Maybe not here.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous Rate”
Reviews.Author: vajanke
Reviews.Content: My husband took me up to NYC for a surprise getaway. I was not allowed to know what the price of the hotel was. We ended up paying $569 with room taxes for one Thursday night. When we got back home to figure out a return trip with the kids I was checking rates and all rates were ranging at the $224- low $300. I am appalled that my husband spent that kinda of money on a no frills midweek room. Upon arriving at the hotel my husband pulled over and blocked the road and let me out so that I could find out where we needed to park the car. I ran up the escalator to the front desk and was told the was a bellman below. I proceeded to head back down the escalator to look all around for a bellman. I didn't see one so I went back out to the card to tell my husband that I was looking for the bellman. He was stressing out because he was in the roadway. Then I went back into the hotel in search of the bellman. I finally found him and he gave me a claim ticket. By this point I head back outside and see that my husband has parked the car across the street. I jump in and tell him that I found the bellman. He starts to get out of the car to get our bags when I finally see the bellman on the other side of the street shaking his head. He then crosses the street and explains to us that we need to move the car to the other side of the street to the hotel loading zone which was previously full. After that we checked in to the hotel with no incident. We arrived at the room and it was a small double bed room with a bath. Nothing special. Upon departure I called for my car. I guess it is my ingnorance in dealing with the valet but when my car arrived the driver was rude to me and told me to wait. I didn't feel that the trip was a waste but felt that when I got back and saw the pricing I didn't feel like I got my moneys worth. I checked the following days rate which was a Friday and it was more than half what we paid. Beware of prices!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mel588
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location, near the cool sites and subway. The beds were so comfy (with a pillow menu!) and the hospitality was one of the best we have encountered in NY. Yes the room was small but no smaller than other hotels in Manhattan, with all the things to do and see I really just want a clean and comfortable room to come back to after dinner. The hotel was very close to little italy so we enjoyed a great pizza and fabulous meatballs! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: PP&Hardware
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before Thanksgiving and I was suprised by how nice the hotel was. The entrance and lobby are more modern than I was anticipating. We stayed on the 14th floor, top floor, and the room was a comfortable size for New York. Bed was comfortable, the towels were thick and new, the room was very clean and nicely appointed. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. We did have breakfast there the next moring strickly out of convenience. The buffet was fine, although I cringe at the price. The location in great! You are right on the cusp of Canal street which is great if you want a knock off handbag or just want to browse the many trinkety type stores. You are also right in Soho which is a great neighborhood for browsing and walking and talking and not having to deal with the massive crowds of Mid-town. We were able to stroll from the hotel to Pastis in the meatpacking district, enjoying the walk and the day at our leisure. There's a subway station a block away on Broadway that has the yellow line, takes you right up into the heart of things (meaning Times Square). For $2 and a few minutes, you are transported into the masses. I would stay at this hotel again. Sure, I'd rather stay at the Mandarin, but I don't have $800 to blow in one night on a hotel. Believe me, their rooms are not that much bigger than the one I had at the HI.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mytravelquestion
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the HI Manhattan Soho/Downtown and had a great stay. Was a bit put off by the vendors on Canal Street on the way to the hotel, but the hotel turned out to be great and located on a quiet street. The room was small but very comfortable, good bed, nice bathroom and front desk staff very friendly. Free and fast wifi was great and helped us make the most of a very short stay. Location was so-so, it does not have a real soho feel to it, but walking a few block you find great shopping and cafés. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and clean, but pricey, and parking was an issue”
Reviews.Author: Matador
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HI SoHo for one night (sat.) and though we spent little time at the hotel, it was a positive, albeit pricey experience. Living near NYC, I've never had to stay overnight at a NYC hotel, so $400/night for a rather small room (barely enough room for 2 beds, and the TV stand was only inches from the corner of one of the beds) was a bit of a shock (then again, I paid $24 for 2 mixed drinks at the SoHo Grand!). However, the beds were comfortable, and the room clean. Staff was very friendly. We drove in (avoid if at all possible), and called the hotel to find out the parking situation. I was told to double park in front and a valet would take care of it. After driving around that area, on a late Sat. Afternoon, the $65 valet fee was a non-issue, but leaving the car unattended, double-parked on Lafayette was an issue. Well one of the staff recommended I simply park it myself, in Edison Parking (1 block east of the hotel), and save myself $30. Guess that paid for the drinks at the Grand ;-). Wish they would have mentioned that on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Muffster
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at the Holiday Inn Oct 10 -12/2008. Room was great, comfy and clean, small however, but friends who were staying at the Solita Clarion down the street had a smaller room for more money and they had really low cielings The beds were super comfortable. I did have a problem with my reservation, thanks to expedia, but the Holiday Inn bent over backwards to help me and finally get me a room. Ron Oz at the front desk was great! Can't beat the location, right off Canal street, everything is within walking distance, great shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfy Bed!”
Reviews.Author: smdaigle
Reviews.Content: One night stay after a late night dinner cruise. The room was perfect for our needs. It was clean and quiet and the beds were very comfy with nice pillow topped mattresses. The room is small (wall to wall beds almost) but that's what we expected. Rather expensive for a one night stay but we booked pretty late so we might have found a better deal if we'd had more time.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet for downtown!”
Reviews.Author: longbridge
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be better located, the rooms were fine, just what we expected. Small, but clean and manageable. One block to Chinatown, two block to Little Italy, 10 minute walk to Soho, etc. Subway about 300 feet from front door. Staff was very friendlty and helpful, went way out of their way to help us find what we wanted. Very safe area, for NYC. Have stayed there often, even when our trip was to other sections of NYC. Doesn't matter, just hop on the subway and go. Many restaurants within a couple minutes walk - ask at the desk, they'll help you.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heathervavoom
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 3 star hotel! I've stayed at many 3 star hotels in NYC and trust me, this is not worth the money you will spend. What's even worse is I booked my room on Priceline (I will NEVER again use this service), so had no way to get out of the reservation once we arrived. The location is DIRTY, right off Canal Street but the good thing was it was close to Broadway shopping and Little Italy dining. If you do find yourself needing to book a room here, ladies, do yourself a favor and pack your own shampoo and conditioner. This is the only 3 star hotel in NYC that offers 2 in 1 shampoo/conditioner, go figure! I've also never known an upscale hotel to have slamming mechanisms on the doors. Our stay Saturday night (the night before we had to be at work for a trade show) we were constantly SLAM awakened by people SLAM moving from room to room SLAM after a night out on the town SLAM. Bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SallymaeMontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for four days in July and absolutely loved it. The room was very clean and the beds very comfy, the decor was outdated but it is costly to keep up with current themes. Staff was very helpful and even had our room ready way before the standard check in time. The one flaw was that we had a handicap washroom and thus the floor were always wet after taking a shower. Not noisey at all despite being abovethe subway. Would recommend anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would cojme again!”
Reviews.Author: 2kayak
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Yes the room is small but it's NYC and we were hardly ever in it - the bed was the MOST comfortable hotel bed I've ever experienced. The hotel is right on Lafeyette near Canal so close to shopping if you so choose, and the subway line is right there. That being said, it is like a clean, quiet oasis in the middle of all the Chinatown chaos. It has a restaurant and workout room, and the front desk is quite helpful. The building is within easy walking distance of Tribeca, Greenwich Village, NYU, and Little Italy. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Normand53
Reviews.Content: Due to a flight problem, I booked one room at Holiday Inn Downtown at past midnight mid June. Indeed, the hotel should rather be named Chinatown. Fairly easy to find, close to Canal St station and to walk from the metro elevator. The desk staff and the security guard were very kind and warm welcoming, even I arrived at 2am. I was upgraded to an executive room (the #12 ones) on the corner of Hoaward & Lafayette St. But the room (6th floor) was very noisy due to cars, lorryes and vans passing around in Howard, Lafayette and Broadway. Even worse, the air cond. are fairly old (inside engines on 2 windows) and made a very loud noise. Either you stop them and sweat, either you let them run but could not sleep in both cases. Curtains do not close completely so you got light inside early morning. The buffet breakfast was good but not great for 25$ (tax & service incl.). The overall price I paid was good (due to my corporate rate) but it was not worth the bargain due to the noise. Maybe executive rooms in the higher floors are better. But, I will never test it again. ps : I noticed many high standard european hotel chains offer lower quality level in USA (Holiday Inn, Radisson)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mum238
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial weekend and have never seen New York so busy. The hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge, Canal Street, Mulberry Street etc. Despite the number of people staying, all the staff were attentive to our needs and happy to advise us on places to go. On leaving the hotel to return to JFK the hotel organised a cab for us, at a reasonable rate. Unfortunately due to last minute shopping and the horrific traffic we were an hour later then planned returning to the hotel, but the cab was still waiting and as we had run out of cash, the hotel paid the driver and charged it to our room. What superb customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the $ if you get the right room....”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: Prime location. I asked to see a few rooms before selecting one. Stayed in a HUGE room with tons of windows, sunlight, a table and chairs and a couch for $375 per night. This place was bigger than most NYC apartments. Teensy bathroom. Super clean. Ask for room #12 on any floor and you'll see what I mean by BIG. Price of the room fluctuates depending on the day. My $375 per night room jumped to $415 for one night, then came back down. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “It is in Soho”
Reviews.Author: WTLMY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown - Soho May 1 to May 6. First for everyone that stated otherwise, the traditional boundaries of Soho (debated by some) extend to the corner of Canal and Lafayette, so it is just inside the Soho boundaries. Chinatown has just grown outside of its old boundaries and continues to grow. The same distance from the front door to Canal Street has you right on the corner of Howard and Broadway, which is so unlike Chinatown you'd think you were nowhere near it. Having gotten that off my chest, the hotel was pretty damn good. Staff were really helpful and friendly, the room and bathroom were relatively clean (cleaner than my own at home!) and the beds were just about the most comfortable I have slept in at a hotel. We were on the 6th floor on the side away from the street and the only time we could hear the subway was when we were in the bathroom, and even then it was a minor thing. Never disturbed our sleep at all. If you are from a small town, the noise in general might be distracting, but then again this is New York. If you are worried about noise in ANY hotel in New York, ask for one on a higher floor. You can't beat the location. Broadway is a block away. From the corner of Lafayette and Canal you can see City Hall in the Financial District (one subway stop away or about a 10 minute walk) which is right at the foot of the Brooklyn Bridge. 15 minutes east and you are in the heart of the Lower East Side; 15 minutes west takes you through Soho and into either Greenwich Village or Tribeca. And the subway is right there; in just over half an hour we were up in Washington Heights on our way to the Cloisters. If you want a real New York experience, stay here. Far better than being up at Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but some problems that makes me scared”
Reviews.Author: naanmarih
Reviews.Content: JUst recently April 20 , 2008 we checked in Holiday Inn, right in the heart of the chinatown, NYC downtown/Soho .Our bedroom was really impressive, but unfortunately the rumbles of the subway underneath makes me awake all night long. The subway runs 24 hours and it really bothers me. It's like there's always an airplane attack on that area and sometimes the building vibrates. Scary and very tiring for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kittycat1961
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really in SOHO but in Chinatown. It is in an awesome location. You can walk or take a short subway ride (one block away) to many area attractions. You are in the heart of Chinatown and two blocks from Little Italy. I am a native New Yorker now living in Wisconsin. I took my daughter and her best friend to New York for spring break. I was EXTREMELY impressed with the hotel, the staff, the room and especially the comfy beds! Our room was on the thirteenth floor with a view of the Brooklyn Bridge. I would defiantly request a high floor at the time of your booking. The staff was always upbeat and accommodating. We stayed at the hotel for five nights. One night I woke up to what sounded like an out of control party. I called security and they were there in less than one minute!!!!!!!!! They took care of the problem and we didn't hear a peep for the rest of the night!! The room was very clean and the beds are so comfy. I had no problem falling asleep! Please let me know if you need any further info on the hotel or NYC.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION and comfort”
Reviews.Author: LordKelvin
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn "Soho" is really in Chinatown to which I say HOORAY for that. My family consists of a 16 year old a 20 year old and two aging hipster parents. I was warned that the rooms were small, however, with four large persons in a two Q room plus rollout we were just fine. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, there was absolutely no need to with the abundant choices directly nearby. The location was superb for hopping on the MTA to everywhere in town, shopping of any kind, eating great food in Chinatown, Soho, Little Italy, Little India, even walking to the Village, yeah you can do it all from here. We stayed out late and walked in past midnight, with no problems encountered in this area (stay alert in NYC no matter where you are going). We found the room quiet and clean (high floor helped). Subway rumbles underneath the building, be aware of this but it did not disturb us. If you want luxury then don't stay here, go uptown and pay twice as much! And the Ten Ren tea company is right next door. - start the day off with some great chinese tea. Definitely a proper choice for a more interesting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: BevAlan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights it was free using my Holiday Inn Priority points. The location was great being close to Little Italy and China Town, the room was compact but it was clean so it ticked the first two most important boxes for us location and cleaness. The only issue was we stayed on the 5th floor and there was a lot of noise from the subway. I'd stay again but would request a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for credit card charges and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Pants01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2007 and had a fairly enjoyable visit. It was undergoing construction at the time but the staff was friendly and helpful. I made an arrangment to go back to the same hotel in March 2008. I made my reservation in early Feb. When I reserved the room, the hotel website only gave me "estimated charges." Nevertheless, my credit card was charged for a rate that I never agreed upon. When I called up the reservations manager, Maryann, she was extremely rude and not helpful. When I asked her to email me a confirmation email with the charges (I was never emailed one despite being charged $2500), she said she would...but I have to call continuously to have it emailed. Beware of charges at this hotel. I would not recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear..... what a letdown”
Reviews.Author: Chap_in_UK
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and use hotels in the Holiday inn chain as my mainstay whilst away (at least 2 nights a week). Being a Platinum Points card holder I guess I can say that I know the Chain rather well, and that on the whole what you pay for is what you get. However, this hotel is without doubt the most disappointing and poor quality I have encountered. The rooms even for NYC were tiny, the standard of house keeping was poor with bed linen crumpled, making one wonder if the cleaners had in fact changed the sheets from the previous occupants. The price of the room was no way proportional to the size, standard or value one would expect from such a well known brand. The staff seemed embarrassed by the state of the room and did offer an alternative which was not that much better but after flying for 8 hours was suffice for a one night stay, but in the cold light of day stained wall paper and threadbare carpet are not acceptable nor is dust on most surfaces. We picked this hotel because of the central location to many of the downtown areas of NYC..... top tip, don’t bother stay further uptown and bus to the sites instead. We were due to spend 6 nights there before moving on to Northern MA, we checked out the following morning at 8am and went straight to the Crown Plaza in Times Square...which is from where I pen this despondent note. I know the arguments and use them myself that you only use a hotel room as a base whilst in NYC, but in all honesty.. DSS hostel occupants would have raised their eyebrows at this mediocre offering which has allowed the general run down area of Chinatown and Little Italy to invade the building.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair1976
Reviews.Content: An average hotel with small rooms and tatty decor. Good service but you need to keep on top of the cleaners who fail to fill up the basic hygiene and bottled water supplies. Great location close to the subway and good restaurants, reasonable value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: h0tmail
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff. Beware, though: even from a higher floor, every time a subway train passed underneath the street it rattled the room and fixtures. Lots of noise heard from the street as well, loud trucks even at night. Maybe it depends on what side of the hotel you are on. Room was clean and well-appointed. Free NY Post and USA Today outside your door in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “small shabby room, noisy”
Reviews.Author: LeedsGlobalman
Reviews.Content: Good location for Chinatown, Little Italy and SOHO, but, the rooms are very small,dated and if your facing onto Lafayette very, very noisy. The staff are OK, the bar is OK, there is free internet, and for 180 USD not to bad overall, but in general it is not up to HInns usual standard full service brand. So if you are OK with small and noisy rooms its OK.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: deedwa
Reviews.Content: My first time to stay at the Holiday Inn SoHo, my friends second. Perfectly located for shopping on Canal St, Broadway, SoHo, Century 21 or a stroll to Union square. We ordered in breakfast sandwiches (sausage, egg & cheese on a bagel - delish! ) and coffee every morning from the Jubille deli around the corner on Broadway - less than $10. The front desk have the number. Abduhl the bell-hop couldn't have been more helpful and pleasant to deal with. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: jimgdc
Reviews.Content: We had some mixed reactions with this hotel. We originally booked it because we wanted a different experience from Midtown. However, we ended up a bit disapointed. Its tucked into a boring corner of Chinatown (maybe its technically SoHo, but the surroundings and the writing on the hotel let you know its Chinatown) We ended up having to cab it quite a bit (you can also subway to most locations within 1-6 blocks) as there was a lack of restuarants and entertainment in the area. Rooms were small and the rooms were a little dingy. But it was cheap at $160. Don't think I'll stay there again, I'll be sticking to the Midtown and the UWS.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NEGirl-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends for Columbis Day weekend. Found this to be a cheaper alternative to staying in Midtown. Hotel was very nice, room was a bit larger than average because we had two double beds, found room to be very clean. We walked the few blocks to Little Italy each night, and being three woman we felt very safe. My only complaint was the hotel restaurant, we did eat breakfast there on the day we checked out. The service was horrible as was the food, not at all what the menu described it to be. However, I would definitely stay here again, but only as an alternative to Midtown simply due tot he long cab rides and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: theredtomato
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights at the Holiday Inn. Nestled between Soho and Chinatown, the hotel is a short walk from the Village. The room was very small, though it was clean and the staff always helpful. While the hotel is ordinary, you are paying for a reliable name and a good location. Well worth it if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good,”
Reviews.Author: jwg41859
Reviews.Content: Good, friendly staff, decent location, but found the room small and abit cramped, Odd placement of the Air Conditiner/Heater. In window, next to bed.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: waldrich
Reviews.Content: the quality of the experience is above-average given its relatively low price and good location. (I call it a "good location" because I like staying downtown and it's a reasonable walk to Soho and Tribeca. This ain't the upper east side or central park west.) the staff all were authentically polite and the place was great for my wife, me and our 16 month old, along with my parents, spread across 2 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , best rates and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelVav
Reviews.Content: With such mixed reviews I didnt know what to expect, but, I was very pleased with the room we got and the overall service was great.
